         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">FERDINAND, king of Navarre.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">BIRON</span>
                        <span class="personname">LONGAVILLE</span>
                        <span class="personname">DUMAIN</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">lords attending on the King.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">BOYET</span>
                        <span class="personname">MERCADE</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">lords attending on the Princess of France.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, a fantastical Spaniard.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SIR NATHANIEL, a curate.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HOLOFERNES, a schoolmaster.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">DULL, a constable.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">COSTARD, a clown.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MOTH, page to Armado.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Forester.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">The PRINCESS of France.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">ROSALINE</span>
                        <span class="personname">MARIA</span>
                        <span class="personname">KATHARINE</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">ladies attending on the Princess.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">JAQUENETTA, a country wench.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Attendants, &c.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Navarre.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  The king of Navarre's park.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The king of Navarre's park.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FERDINAND king of Navarre, BIRON, LONGAVILLE
and DUMAIN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Let fame, that all hunt after in their lives,</div>
                     <div class="line">Live register'd upon our brazen tombs</div>
                     <div class="line">And then grace us in the disgrace of death;</div>
                     <div class="line">When, spite of cormorant devouring Time,</div>
                     <div class="line">The endeavor of this present breath may buy</div>
                     <div class="line">That honour which shall bate his scythe's keen edge</div>
                     <div class="line">And make us heirs of all eternity.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, brave conquerors,--for so you are,</div>
                     <div class="line">That war against your own affections</div>
                     <div class="line">And the huge army of the world's desires,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Our late edict shall strongly stand in force:</div>
                     <div class="line">Navarre shall be the wonder of the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our court shall be a little Academe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still and contemplative in living art.</div>
                     <div class="line">You three, Biron, Dumain, and Longaville,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have sworn for three years' term to live with me</div>
                     <div class="line">My fellow-scholars, and to keep those statutes</div>
                     <div class="line">That are recorded in this schedule here:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your oaths are pass'd; and now subscribe your names,</div>
                     <div class="line">That his own hand may strike his honour down</div>
                     <div class="line">That violates the smallest branch herein:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you are arm'd to do as sworn to do,</div>
                     <div class="line">Subscribe to your deep oaths, and keep it too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am resolved; 'tis but a three years' fast:</div>
                     <div class="line">The mind shall banquet, though the body pine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fat paunches have lean pates, and dainty bits</div>
                     <div class="line">Make rich the ribs, but bankrupt quite the wits.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">My loving lord, Dumain is mortified:</div>
                     <div class="line">The grosser manner of these world's delights</div>
                     <div class="line">He throws upon the gross world's baser slaves:</div>
                     <div class="line">To love, to wealth, to pomp, I pine and die;</div>
                     <div class="line">With all these living in philosophy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I can but say their protestation over;</div>
                     <div class="line">So much, dear liege, I have already sworn,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, to live and study here three years.</div>
                     <div class="line">But there are other strict observances;</div>
                     <div class="line">As, not to see a woman in that term,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I hope well is not enrolled there;</div>
                     <div class="line">And one day in a week to touch no food</div>
                     <div class="line">And but one meal on every day beside,</div>
                     <div class="line">The which I hope is not enrolled there;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then, to sleep but three hours in the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And not be seen to wink of all the day--</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was wont to think no harm all night</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a dark night too of half the day--</div>
                     <div class="line">Which I hope well is not enrolled there:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, these are barren tasks, too hard to keep,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to see ladies, study, fast, not sleep!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Your oath is pass'd to pass away from these.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me say no, my liege, an if you please:</div>
                     <div class="line">I only swore to study with your grace</div>
                     <div class="line">And stay here in your court for three years' space.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">You swore to that, Biron, and to the rest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">By yea and nay, sir, then I swore in jest.</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the end of study? let me know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that to know, which else we should not know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Things hid and barr'd, you mean, from common sense?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that is study's godlike recompense.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, then; I will swear to study so,</div>
                     <div class="line">To know the thing I am forbid to know:</div>
                     <div class="line">As thus,--to study where I well may dine,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I to feast expressly am forbid;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or study where to meet some mistress fine,</div>
                     <div class="line">When mistresses from common sense are hid;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, having sworn too hard a keeping oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Study to break it and not break my troth.</div>
                     <div class="line">If study's gain be thus and this be so,</div>
                     <div class="line">Study knows that which yet it doth not know:</div>
                     <div class="line">Swear me to this, and I will ne'er say no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">These be the stops that hinder study quite</div>
                     <div class="line">And train our intellects to vain delight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, all delights are vain; but that most vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which with pain purchased doth inherit pain:</div>
                     <div class="line">As, painfully to pore upon a book</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek the light of truth; while truth the while</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth falsely blind the eyesight of his look:</div>
                     <div class="line">Light seeking light doth light of light beguile:</div>
                     <div class="line">So, ere you find where light in darkness lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your light grows dark by losing of your eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Study me how to please the eye indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">By fixing it upon a fairer eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dazzling so, that eye shall be his heed</div>
                     <div class="line">And give him light that it was blinded by.</div>
                     <div class="line">Study is like the heaven's glorious sun</div>
                     <div class="line">That will not be deep-search'd with saucy looks:</div>
                     <div class="line">Small have continual plodders ever won</div>
                     <div class="line">Save base authority from others' books</div>
                     <div class="line">These earthly godfathers of heaven's lights</div>
                     <div class="line">That give a name to every fixed star</div>
                     <div class="line">Have no more profit of their shining nights</div>
                     <div class="line">Than those that walk and wot not what they are.</div>
                     <div class="line">Too much to know is to know nought but fame;</div>
                     <div class="line">And every godfather can give a name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">How well he's read, to reason against reading!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceeded well, to stop all good proceeding!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">He weeds the corn and still lets grow the weeding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">The spring is near when green geese are a-breeding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">How follows that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Fit in his place and time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">In reason nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Something then in rhyme.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Biron is like an envious sneaping frost,</div>
                     <div class="line">That bites the first-born infants of the spring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, say I am; why should proud summer boast</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the birds have any cause to sing?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should I joy in any abortive birth?</div>
                     <div class="line">At Christmas I no more desire a rose</div>
                     <div class="line">Than wish a snow in May's new-fangled mirth;</div>
                     <div class="line">But like of each thing that in season grows.</div>
                     <div class="line">So you, to study now it is too late,</div>
                     <div class="line">Climb o'er the house to unlock the little gate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sit you out: go home, Biron: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord; I have sworn to stay with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">And though I have for barbarism spoke more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than for that angel knowledge you can say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet confident I'll keep what I have swore</div>
                     <div class="line">And bide the penance of each three years' day.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the paper; let me read the same;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to the strict'st decrees I'll write my name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">How well this yielding rescues thee from shame!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Item, That no woman shall come within a</div>
                     <div class="line">mile of my court:' Hath this been proclaimed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Four days ago.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's see the penalty.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'On pain of losing her tongue.' Who devised this penalty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, that did I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lord, and why?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">To fright them hence with that dread penalty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">A dangerous law against gentility!</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">'Item, If any man be seen to talk with a woman</div>
                     <div class="line">within the term of three years, he shall endure such</div>
                     <div class="line">public shame as the rest of the court can possibly devise.'</div>
                     <div class="line">This article, my liege, yourself must break;</div>
                     <div class="line">For well you know here comes in embassy</div>
                     <div class="line">The French king's daughter with yourself to speak--</div>
                     <div class="line">A maid of grace and complete majesty--</div>
                     <div class="line">About surrender up of Aquitaine</div>
                     <div class="line">To her decrepit, sick and bedrid father:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore this article is made in vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or vainly comes the admired princess hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What say you, lords? Why, this was quite forgot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">So study evermore is overshot:</div>
                     <div class="line">While it doth study to have what it would</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth forget to do the thing it should,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when it hath the thing it hunteth most,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis won as towns with fire, so won, so lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">We must of force dispense with this decree;</div>
                     <div class="line">She must lie here on mere necessity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Necessity will make us all forsworn</div>
                     <div class="line">Three thousand times within this three years' space;</div>
                     <div class="line">For every man with his affects is born,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not by might master'd but by special grace:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I break faith, this word shall speak for me;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am forsworn on 'mere necessity.'</div>
                     <div class="line">So to the laws at large I write my name:</div>
                     <p>Subscribes</p>
                     <div class="line">And he that breaks them in the least degree</div>
                     <div class="line">Stands in attainder of eternal shame:</div>
                     <div class="line">Suggestions are to other as to me;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I believe, although I seem so loath,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the last that will last keep his oath.</div>
                     <div class="line">But is there no quick recreation granted?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, that there is. Our court, you know, is haunted</div>
                     <div class="line">With a refined traveller of Spain;</div>
                     <div class="line">A man in all the world's new fashion planted,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath a mint of phrases in his brain;</div>
                     <div class="line">One whom the music of his own vain tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth ravish like enchanting harmony;</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of complements, whom right and wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">Have chose as umpire of their mutiny:</div>
                     <div class="line">This child of fancy, that Armado hight,</div>
                     <div class="line">For interim to our studies shall relate</div>
                     <div class="line">In high-born words the worth of many a knight</div>
                     <div class="line">From tawny Spain lost in the world's debate.</div>
                     <div class="line">How you delight, my lords, I know not, I;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, I protest, I love to hear him lie</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will use him for my minstrelsy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Armado is a most illustrious wight,</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of fire-new words, fashion's own knight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Costard the swain and he shall be our sport;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so to study, three years is but short.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DULL with a letter, and COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the duke's own person?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This, fellow: what wouldst?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">I myself reprehend his own person, for I am his</div>
                     <div class="line">grace's tharborough: but I would see his own person</div>
                     <div class="line">in flesh and blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This is he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Arme--Arme--commends you. There's villany</div>
                     <div class="line">abroad: this letter will tell you more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, the contempts thereof are as touching me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">A letter from the magnificent Armado.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">How low soever the matter, I hope in God for high words.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">A high hope for a low heaven: God grant us patience!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear? or forbear laughing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">To hear meekly, sir, and to laugh moderately; or to</div>
                     <div class="line">forbear both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, be it as the style shall give us cause to</div>
                     <div class="line">climb in the merriness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">The matter is to me, sir, as concerning Jaquenetta.</div>
                     <div class="line">The manner of it is, I was taken with the manner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">In what manner?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">In manner and form following, sir; all those three:</div>
                     <div class="line">I was seen with her in the manor-house, sitting with</div>
                     <div class="line">her upon the form, and taken following her into the</div>
                     <div class="line">park; which, put together, is in manner and form</div>
                     <div class="line">following. Now, sir, for the manner,--it is the</div>
                     <div class="line">manner of a man to speak to a woman: for the form,--</div>
                     <div class="line">in some form.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">For the following, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">As it shall follow in my correction: and God defend</div>
                     <div class="line">the right!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you hear this letter with attention?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">As we would hear an oracle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Such is the simplicity of man to hearken after the flesh.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'Great deputy, the welkin's vicegerent and</div>
                     <div class="line">sole dominator of Navarre, my soul's earth's god,</div>
                     <div class="line">and body's fostering patron.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a word of Costard yet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'So it is,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">It may be so: but if he say it is so, he is, in</div>
                     <div class="line">telling true, but so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Be to me and every man that dares not fight!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">No words!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Of other men's secrets, I beseech you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'So it is, besieged with sable-coloured</div>
                     <div class="line">melancholy, I did commend the black-oppressing humour</div>
                     <div class="line">to the most wholesome physic of thy health-giving</div>
                     <div class="line">air; and, as I am a gentleman, betook myself to</div>
                     <div class="line">walk. The time when. About the sixth hour; when</div>
                     <div class="line">beasts most graze, birds best peck, and men sit down</div>
                     <div class="line">to that nourishment which is called supper: so much</div>
                     <div class="line">for the time when. Now for the ground which; which,</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean, I walked upon: it is y-cleped thy park. Then</div>
                     <div class="line">for the place where; where, I mean, I did encounter</div>
                     <div class="line">that obscene and preposterous event, that draweth</div>
                     <div class="line">from my snow-white pen the ebon-coloured ink, which</div>
                     <div class="line">here thou viewest, beholdest, surveyest, or seest;</div>
                     <div class="line">but to the place where; it standeth north-north-east</div>
                     <div class="line">and by east from the west corner of thy curious-</div>
                     <div class="line">knotted garden: there did I see that low-spirited</div>
                     <div class="line">swain, that base minnow of thy mirth,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'that unlettered small-knowing soul,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'that shallow vassal,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Still me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'which, as I remember, hight Costard,'--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O, me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'sorted and consorted, contrary to thy</div>
                     <div class="line">established proclaimed edict and continent canon,</div>
                     <div class="line">which with,--O, with--but with this I passion to say</div>
                     <div class="line">wherewith,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">With a wench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'with a child of our grandmother Eve, a</div>
                     <div class="line">female; or, for thy more sweet understanding, a</div>
                     <div class="line">woman. Him I, as my ever-esteemed duty pricks me on,</div>
                     <div class="line">have sent to thee, to receive the meed of</div>
                     <div class="line">punishment, by thy sweet grace's officer, Anthony</div>
                     <div class="line">Dull; a man of good repute, carriage, bearing, and</div>
                     <div class="line">estimation.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Me, an't shall please you; I am Anthony Dull.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>  'For Jaquenetta,--so is the weaker vessel</div>
                     <div class="line">called which I apprehended with the aforesaid</div>
                     <div class="line">swain,--I keep her as a vessel of the law's fury;</div>
                     <div class="line">and shall, at the least of thy sweet notice, bring</div>
                     <div class="line">her to trial. Thine, in all compliments of devoted</div>
                     <div class="line">and heart-burning heat of duty.</div>
                     <div class="line">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This is not so well as I looked for, but the best</div>
                     <div class="line">that ever I heard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, the best for the worst. But, sirrah, what say</div>
                     <div class="line">you to this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I confess the wench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you hear the proclamation?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I do confess much of the hearing it but little of</div>
                     <div class="line">the marking of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">It was proclaimed a year's imprisonment, to be taken</div>
                     <div class="line">with a wench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I was taken with none, sir: I was taken with a damsel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, it was proclaimed 'damsel.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">This was no damsel, neither, sir; she was a virgin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">It is so varied, too; for it was proclaimed 'virgin.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">If it were, I deny her virginity: I was taken with a maid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">This maid will not serve your turn, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">This maid will serve my turn, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I will pronounce your sentence: you shall fast</div>
                     <div class="line">a week with bran and water.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I had rather pray a month with mutton and porridge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And Don Armado shall be your keeper.</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord Biron, see him deliver'd o'er:</div>
                     <div class="line">And go we, lords, to put in practise that</div>
                     <div class="line">Which each to other hath so strongly sworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt FERDINAND, LONGAVILLE, and DUMAIN</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll lay my head to any good man's hat,</div>
                     <div class="line">These oaths and laws will prove an idle scorn.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, come on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I suffer for the truth, sir; for true it is, I was</div>
                     <div class="line">taken with Jaquenetta, and Jaquenetta is a true</div>
                     <div class="line">girl; and therefore welcome the sour cup of</div>
                     <div class="line">prosperity! Affliction may one day smile again; and</div>
                     <div class="line">till then, sit thee down, sorrow!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO and MOTH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Boy, what sign is it when a man of great spirit</div>
                     <div class="line">grows melancholy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A great sign, sir, that he will look sad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sadness is one and the self-same thing, dear imp.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no; O Lord, sir, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">How canst thou part sadness and melancholy, my</div>
                     <div class="line">tender juvenal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">By a familiar demonstration of the working, my tough senior.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why tough senior? why tough senior?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why tender juvenal? why tender juvenal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I spoke it, tender juvenal, as a congruent epitheton</div>
                     <div class="line">appertaining to thy young days, which we may</div>
                     <div class="line">nominate tender.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, tough senior, as an appertinent title to your</div>
                     <div class="line">old time, which we may name tough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pretty and apt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">How mean you, sir? I pretty, and my saying apt? or</div>
                     <div class="line">I apt, and my saying pretty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou pretty, because little.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Little pretty, because little. Wherefore apt?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore apt, because quick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak you this in my praise, master?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">In thy condign praise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will praise an eel with the same praise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">What, that an eel is ingenious?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">That an eel is quick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I do say thou art quick in answers: thou heatest my blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">I am answered, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I love not to be crossed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  He speaks the mere contrary; crosses love not him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have promised to study three years with the duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">You may do it in an hour, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Impossible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">How many is one thrice told?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am ill at reckoning; it fitteth the spirit of a tapster.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">You are a gentleman and a gamester, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I confess both: they are both the varnish of a</div>
                     <div class="line">complete man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, I am sure, you know how much the gross sum of</div>
                     <div class="line">deuce-ace amounts to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">It doth amount to one more than two.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Which the base vulgar do call three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">True.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, sir, is this such a piece of study? Now here</div>
                     <div class="line">is three studied, ere ye'll thrice wink: and how</div>
                     <div class="line">easy it is to put 'years' to the word 'three,' and</div>
                     <div class="line">study three years in two words, the dancing horse</div>
                     <div class="line">will tell you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">A most fine figure!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">To prove you a cipher.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will hereupon confess I am in love: and as it is</div>
                     <div class="line">base for a soldier to love, so am I in love with a</div>
                     <div class="line">base wench. If drawing my sword against the humour</div>
                     <div class="line">of affection would deliver me from the reprobate</div>
                     <div class="line">thought of it, I would take Desire prisoner, and</div>
                     <div class="line">ransom him to any French courtier for a new-devised</div>
                     <div class="line">courtesy. I think scorn to sigh: methinks I should</div>
                     <div class="line">outswear Cupid. Comfort, me, boy: what great men</div>
                     <div class="line">have been in love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hercules, master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Most sweet Hercules! More authority, dear boy, name</div>
                     <div class="line">more; and, sweet my child, let them be men of good</div>
                     <div class="line">repute and carriage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Samson, master: he was a man of good carriage, great</div>
                     <div class="line">carriage, for he carried the town-gates on his back</div>
                     <div class="line">like a porter: and he was in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">O well-knit Samson! strong-jointed Samson! I do</div>
                     <div class="line">excel thee in my rapier as much as thou didst me in</div>
                     <div class="line">carrying gates. I am in love too. Who was Samson's</div>
                     <div class="line">love, my dear Moth?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman, master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Of what complexion?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all the four, or the three, or the two, or one of the four.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me precisely of what complexion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the sea-water green, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that one of the four complexions?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">As I have read, sir; and the best of them too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Green indeed is the colour of lovers; but to have a</div>
                     <div class="line">love of that colour, methinks Samson had small reason</div>
                     <div class="line">for it. He surely affected her for her wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">It was so, sir; for she had a green wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">My love is most immaculate white and red.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Most maculate thoughts, master, are masked under</div>
                     <div class="line">such colours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Define, define, well-educated infant.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">My father's wit and my mother's tongue, assist me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet invocation of a child; most pretty and</div>
                     <div class="line">pathetical!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">If she be made of white and red,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her faults will ne'er be known,</div>
                     <div class="line">For blushing cheeks by faults are bred</div>
                     <div class="line">And fears by pale white shown:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then if she fear, or be to blame,</div>
                     <div class="line">By this you shall not know,</div>
                     <div class="line">For still her cheeks possess the same</div>
                     <div class="line">Which native she doth owe.</div>
                     <div class="line">A dangerous rhyme, master, against the reason of</div>
                     <div class="line">white and red.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there not a ballad, boy, of the King and the Beggar?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">The world was very guilty of such a ballad some</div>
                     <div class="line">three ages since: but I think now 'tis not to be</div>
                     <div class="line">found; or, if it were, it would neither serve for</div>
                     <div class="line">the writing nor the tune.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will have that subject newly writ o'er, that I may</div>
                     <div class="line">example my digression by some mighty precedent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Boy, I do love that country girl that I took in the</div>
                     <div class="line">park with the rational hind Costard: she deserves well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  To be whipped; and yet a better love than</div>
                     <div class="line">my master.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sing, boy; my spirit grows heavy in love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">And that's great marvel, loving a light wench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I say, sing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbear till this company be past.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DULL, COSTARD, and JAQUENETTA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, the duke's pleasure is, that you keep Costard</div>
                     <div class="line">safe: and you must suffer him to take no delight</div>
                     <div class="line">nor no penance; but a' must fast three days a week.</div>
                     <div class="line">For this damsel, I must keep her at the park: she</div>
                     <div class="line">is allowed for the day-woman. Fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I do betray myself with blushing. Maid!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will visit thee at the lodge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">That's hereby.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know where it is situate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, how wise you are!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will tell thee wonders.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">With that face?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I love thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">So I heard you say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair weather after you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Jaquenetta, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt DULL and JAQUENETTA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, thou shalt fast for thy offences ere thou</div>
                     <div class="line">be pardoned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, I hope, when I do it, I shall do it on a</div>
                     <div class="line">full stomach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be heavily punished.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I am more bound to you than your fellows, for they</div>
                     <div class="line">are but lightly rewarded.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Take away this villain; shut him up.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, you transgressing slave; away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not be pent up, sir: I will fast, being loose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir; that were fast and loose: thou shalt to prison.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, if ever I do see the merry days of desolation</div>
                     <div class="line">that I have seen, some shall see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">What shall some see?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, nothing, Master Moth, but what they look upon.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not for prisoners to be too silent in their</div>
                     <div class="line">words; and therefore I will say nothing: I thank</div>
                     <div class="line">God I have as little patience as another man; and</div>
                     <div class="line">therefore I can be quiet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt MOTH and COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I do affect the very ground, which is base, where</div>
                     <div class="line">her shoe, which is baser, guided by her foot, which</div>
                     <div class="line">is basest, doth tread. I shall be forsworn, which</div>
                     <div class="line">is a great argument of falsehood, if I love. And</div>
                     <div class="line">how can that be true love which is falsely</div>
                     <div class="line">attempted? Love is a familiar; Love is a devil:</div>
                     <div class="line">there is no evil angel but Love. Yet was Samson so</div>
                     <div class="line">tempted, and he had an excellent strength; yet was</div>
                     <div class="line">Solomon so seduced, and he had a very good wit.</div>
