                     <div class="line">Cupid's butt-shaft is too hard for Hercules' club;</div>
                     <div class="line">and therefore too much odds for a Spaniard's rapier.</div>
                     <div class="line">The first and second cause will not serve my turn;</div>
                     <div class="line">the passado he respects not, the duello he regards</div>
                     <div class="line">not: his disgrace is to be called boy; but his</div>
                     <div class="line">glory is to subdue men. Adieu, valour! rust rapier!</div>
                     <div class="line">be still, drum! for your manager is in love; yea,</div>
                     <div class="line">he loveth. Assist me, some extemporal god of rhyme,</div>
                     <div class="line">for I am sure I shall turn sonnet. Devise, wit;</div>
                     <div class="line">write, pen; for I am for whole volumes in folio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCESS of France, ROSALINE, MARIA,
KATHARINE, BOYET, Lords, and other Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, madam, summon up your dearest spirits:</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider who the king your father sends,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom he sends, and what's his embassy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yourself, held precious in the world's esteem,</div>
                     <div class="line">To parley with the sole inheritor</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all perfections that a man may owe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Matchless Navarre; the plea of no less weight</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Aquitaine, a dowry for a queen.</div>
                     <div class="line">Be now as prodigal of all dear grace</div>
                     <div class="line">As Nature was in making graces dear</div>
                     <div class="line">When she did starve the general world beside</div>
                     <div class="line">And prodigally gave them all to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Lord Boyet, my beauty, though but mean,</div>
                     <div class="line">Needs not the painted flourish of your praise:</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauty is bought by judgement of the eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not utter'd by base sale of chapmen's tongues:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am less proud to hear you tell my worth</div>
                     <div class="line">Than you much willing to be counted wise</div>
                     <div class="line">In spending your wit in the praise of mine.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now to task the tasker: good Boyet,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are not ignorant, all-telling fame</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth noise abroad, Navarre hath made a vow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till painful study shall outwear three years,</div>
                     <div class="line">No woman may approach his silent court:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore to's seemeth it a needful course,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before we enter his forbidden gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">To know his pleasure; and in that behalf,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bold of your worthiness, we single you</div>
                     <div class="line">As our best-moving fair solicitor.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him, the daughter of the King of France,</div>
                     <div class="line">On serious business, craving quick dispatch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Importunes personal conference with his grace:</div>
                     <div class="line">Haste, signify so much; while we attend,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like humble-visaged suitors, his high will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud of employment, willingly I go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">All pride is willing pride, and yours is so.</div>
                     <p>Exit BOYET</p>
                     <div class="line">Who are the votaries, my loving lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">That are vow-fellows with this virtuous duke?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord Longaville is one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Know you the man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I know him, madam: at a marriage-feast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Between Lord Perigort and the beauteous heir</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Jaques Falconbridge, solemnized</div>
                     <div class="line">In Normandy, saw I this Longaville:</div>
                     <div class="line">A man of sovereign parts he is esteem'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">Well fitted in arts, glorious in arms:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing becomes him ill that he would well.</div>
                     <div class="line">The only soil of his fair virtue's gloss,</div>
                     <div class="line">If virtue's gloss will stain with any soil,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is a sharp wit matched with too blunt a will;</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose edge hath power to cut, whose will still wills</div>
                     <div class="line">It should none spare that come within his power.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Some merry mocking lord, belike; is't so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">They say so most that most his humours know.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Such short-lived wits do wither as they grow.</div>
                     <div class="line">Who are the rest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">The young Dumain, a well-accomplished youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all that virtue love for virtue loved:</div>
                     <div class="line">Most power to do most harm, least knowing ill;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he hath wit to make an ill shape good,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shape to win grace though he had no wit.</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw him at the Duke Alencon's once;</div>
                     <div class="line">And much too little of that good I saw</div>
                     <div class="line">Is my report to his great worthiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Another of these students at that time</div>
                     <div class="line">Was there with him, if I have heard a truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Biron they call him; but a merrier man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the limit of becoming mirth,</div>
                     <div class="line">I never spent an hour's talk withal:</div>
                     <div class="line">His eye begets occasion for his wit;</div>
                     <div class="line">For every object that the one doth catch</div>
                     <div class="line">The other turns to a mirth-moving jest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which his fair tongue, conceit's expositor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Delivers in such apt and gracious words</div>
                     <div class="line">That aged ears play truant at his tales</div>
                     <div class="line">And younger hearings are quite ravished;</div>
                     <div class="line">So sweet and voluble is his discourse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless my ladies! are they all in love,</div>
                     <div class="line">That every one her own hath garnished</div>
                     <div class="line">With such bedecking ornaments of praise?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Boyet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter BOYET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, what admittance, lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Navarre had notice of your fair approach;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he and his competitors in oath</div>
                     <div class="line">Were all address'd to meet you, gentle lady,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I came. Marry, thus much I have learnt:</div>
                     <div class="line">He rather means to lodge you in the field,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like one that comes here to besiege his court,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than seek a dispensation for his oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">To let you enter his unpeopled house.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Navarre.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter FERDINAND, LONGAVILLE, DUMAIN, BIRON, and
Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair princess, welcome to the court of Navarre.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Fair' I give you back again; and 'welcome' I have</div>
                     <div class="line">not yet: the roof of this court is too high to be</div>
                     <div class="line">yours; and welcome to the wide fields too base to be mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall be welcome, madam, to my court.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be welcome, then: conduct me thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, dear lady; I have sworn an oath.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Our Lady help my lord! he'll be forsworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Not for the world, fair madam, by my will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, will shall break it; will and nothing else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Your ladyship is ignorant what it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Were my lord so, his ignorance were wise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where now his knowledge must prove ignorance.</div>
                     <div class="line">I hear your grace hath sworn out house-keeping:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tis deadly sin to keep that oath, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sin to break it.</div>
                     <div class="line">But pardon me. I am too sudden-bold:</div>
                     <div class="line">To teach a teacher ill beseemeth me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Vouchsafe to read the purpose of my coming,</div>
                     <div class="line">And suddenly resolve me in my suit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I will, if suddenly I may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You will the sooner, that I were away;</div>
                     <div class="line">For you'll prove perjured if you make me stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not I dance with you in Brabant once?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Did not I dance with you in Brabant once?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I know you did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">How needless was it then to ask the question!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not be so quick.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis 'long of you that spur me with such questions.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your wit's too hot, it speeds too fast, 'twill tire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not till it leave the rider in the mire.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">What time o' day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">The hour that fools should ask.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now fair befall your mask!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair fall the face it covers!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">And send you many lovers!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, so you be none.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then will I be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, your father here doth intimate</div>
                     <div class="line">The payment of a hundred thousand crowns;</div>
                     <div class="line">Being but the one half of an entire sum</div>
                     <div class="line">Disbursed by my father in his wars.</div>
                     <div class="line">But say that he or we, as neither have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Received that sum, yet there remains unpaid</div>
                     <div class="line">A hundred thousand more; in surety of the which,</div>
                     <div class="line">One part of Aquitaine is bound to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Although not valued to the money's worth.</div>
                     <div class="line">If then the king your father will restore</div>
                     <div class="line">But that one half which is unsatisfied,</div>
                     <div class="line">We will give up our right in Aquitaine,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hold fair friendship with his majesty.</div>
                     <div class="line">But that, it seems, he little purposeth,</div>
                     <div class="line">For here he doth demand to have repaid</div>
                     <div class="line">A hundred thousand crowns; and not demands,</div>
                     <div class="line">On payment of a hundred thousand crowns,</div>
                     <div class="line">To have his title live in Aquitaine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we much rather had depart withal</div>
                     <div class="line">And have the money by our father lent</div>
                     <div class="line">Than Aquitaine so gelded as it is.</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear Princess, were not his requests so far</div>
                     <div class="line">From reason's yielding, your fair self should make</div>
                     <div class="line">A yielding 'gainst some reason in my breast</div>
                     <div class="line">And go well satisfied to France again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">You do the king my father too much wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">And wrong the reputation of your name,</div>
                     <div class="line">In so unseeming to confess receipt</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that which hath so faithfully been paid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I do protest I never heard of it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if you prove it, I'll repay it back</div>
                     <div class="line">Or yield up Aquitaine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">We arrest your word.</div>
                     <div class="line">Boyet, you can produce acquittances</div>
                     <div class="line">For such a sum from special officers</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Charles his father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Satisfy me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">So please your grace, the packet is not come</div>
                     <div class="line">Where that and other specialties are bound:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow you shall have a sight of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall suffice me: at which interview</div>
                     <div class="line">All liberal reason I will yield unto.</div>
                     <div class="line">Meantime receive such welcome at my hand</div>
                     <div class="line">As honour without breach of honour may</div>
                     <div class="line">Make tender of to thy true worthiness:</div>
                     <div class="line">You may not come, fair princess, in my gates;</div>
                     <div class="line">But here without you shall be so received</div>
                     <div class="line">As you shall deem yourself lodged in my heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though so denied fair harbour in my house.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your own good thoughts excuse me, and farewell:</div>
                     <div class="line">To-morrow shall we visit you again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet health and fair desires consort your grace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy own wish wish I thee in every place!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, I will commend you to mine own heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, do my commendations; I would be glad to see it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I would you heard it groan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Is the fool sick?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Sick at the heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, let it blood.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Would that do it good?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">My physic says 'ay.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you prick't with your eye?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">No point, with my knife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, God save thy life!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">And yours from long living!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot stay thanksgiving.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Retiring</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I pray you, a word: what lady is that same?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">The heir of Alencon, Katharine her name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">A gallant lady. Monsieur, fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you a word: what is she in the white?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman sometimes, an you saw her in the light.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance light in the light. I desire her name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath but one for herself; to desire that were a shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, whose daughter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Her mother's, I have heard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">God's blessing on your beard!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sir, be not offended.</div>
                     <div class="line">She is an heir of Falconbridge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, my choler is ended.</div>
                     <div class="line">She is a most sweet lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Not unlike, sir, that may be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit LONGAVILLE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">What's her name in the cap?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosaline, by good hap.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is she wedded or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">To her will, sir, or so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">You are welcome, sir: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell to me, sir, and welcome to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit BIRON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That last is Biron, the merry madcap lord:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a word with him but a jest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">And every jest but a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">It was well done of you to take him at his word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">I was as willing to grapple as he was to board.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Two hot sheeps, marry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">And wherefore not ships?</div>
                     <div class="line">No sheep, sweet lamb, unless we feed on your lips.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You sheep, and I pasture: shall that finish the jest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">So you grant pasture for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Offering to kiss her</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, gentle beast:</div>
                     <div class="line">My lips are no common, though several they be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Belonging to whom?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">To my fortunes and me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Good wits will be jangling; but, gentles, agree:</div>
                     <div class="line">This civil war of wits were much better used</div>
                     <div class="line">On Navarre and his book-men; for here 'tis abused.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">If my observation, which very seldom lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the heart's still rhetoric disclosed with eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deceive me not now, Navarre is infected.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">With what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">With that which we lovers entitle affected.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Your reason?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, all his behaviors did make their retire</div>
                     <div class="line">To the court of his eye, peeping thorough desire:</div>
                     <div class="line">His heart, like an agate, with your print impress'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proud with his form, in his eye pride express'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">His tongue, all impatient to speak and not see,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did stumble with haste in his eyesight to be;</div>
                     <div class="line">All senses to that sense did make their repair,</div>
                     <div class="line">To feel only looking on fairest of fair:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methought all his senses were lock'd in his eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">As jewels in crystal for some prince to buy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, tendering their own worth from where they were glass'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did point you to buy them, along as you pass'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">His face's own margent did quote such amazes</div>
                     <div class="line">That all eyes saw his eyes enchanted with gazes.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll give you Aquitaine and all that is his,</div>
                     <div class="line">An you give him for my sake but one loving kiss.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to our pavilion: Boyet is disposed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">But to speak that in words which his eye hath</div>
                     <div class="line">disclosed.</div>
                     <div class="line">I only have made a mouth of his eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">By adding a tongue which I know will not lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art an old love-monger and speakest skilfully.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He is Cupid's grandfather and learns news of him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then was Venus like her mother, for her father is but grim.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you hear, my mad wenches?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">No.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">What then, do you see?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, our way to be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too hard for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO and MOTH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Warble, child; make passionate my sense of hearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Concolinel.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Singing</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet air! Go, tenderness of years; take this key,</div>
                     <div class="line">give enlargement to the swain, bring him festinately</div>
                     <div class="line">hither: I must employ him in a letter to my love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, will you win your love with a French brawl?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">How meanest thou? brawling in French?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my complete master: but to jig off a tune at</div>
                     <div class="line">the tongue's end, canary to it with your feet, humour</div>
                     <div class="line">it with turning up your eyelids, sigh a note and</div>
                     <div class="line">sing a note, sometime through the throat, as if you</div>
                     <div class="line">swallowed love with singing love, sometime through</div>
                     <div class="line">the nose, as if you snuffed up love by smelling</div>
                     <div class="line">love; with your hat penthouse-like o'er the shop of</div>
                     <div class="line">your eyes; with your arms crossed on your thin-belly</div>
                     <div class="line">doublet like a rabbit on a spit; or your hands in</div>
                     <div class="line">your pocket like a man after the old painting; and</div>
                     <div class="line">keep not too long in one tune, but a snip and away.</div>
                     <div class="line">These are complements, these are humours; these</div>
                     <div class="line">betray nice wenches, that would be betrayed without</div>
                     <div class="line">these; and make them men of note--do you note</div>
                     <div class="line">me?--that most are affected to these.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">How hast thou purchased this experience?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">By my penny of observation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">But O,--but O,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">'The hobby-horse is forgot.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Callest thou my love 'hobby-horse'?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">No, master; the hobby-horse is but a colt, and your</div>
                     <div class="line">love perhaps a hackney. But have you forgot your love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Almost I had.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Negligent student! learn her by heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">By heart and in heart, boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">And out of heart, master: all those three I will prove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">What wilt thou prove?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A man, if I live; and this, by, in, and without, upon</div>
                     <div class="line">the instant: by heart you love her, because your</div>
                     <div class="line">heart cannot come by her; in heart you love her,</div>
                     <div class="line">because your heart is in love with her; and out of</div>
                     <div class="line">heart you love her, being out of heart that you</div>
                     <div class="line">cannot enjoy her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am all these three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">And three times as much more, and yet nothing at</div>
                     <div class="line">all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetch hither the swain: he must carry me a letter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A message well sympathized; a horse to be ambassador</div>
                     <div class="line">for an ass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, ha! what sayest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, you must send the ass upon the horse,</div>
                     <div class="line">for he is very slow-gaited. But I go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The way is but short: away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">As swift as lead, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The meaning, pretty ingenious?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not lead a metal heavy, dull, and slow?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Minime, honest master; or rather, master, no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I say lead is slow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">You are too swift, sir, to say so:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that lead slow which is fired from a gun?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet smoke of rhetoric!</div>
                     <div class="line">He reputes me a cannon; and the bullet, that's he:</div>
                     <div class="line">I shoot thee at the swain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Thump then and I flee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">A most acute juvenal; voluble and free of grace!</div>
                     <div class="line">By thy favour, sweet welkin, I must sigh in thy face:</div>
                     <div class="line">Most rude melancholy, valour gives thee place.</div>
                     <div class="line">My herald is return'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter MOTH with COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A wonder, master! here's a costard broken in a shin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Some enigma, some riddle: come, thy l'envoy; begin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">No enigma, no riddle, no l'envoy; no salve in the</div>
                     <div class="line">mail, sir: O, sir, plantain, a plain plantain! no</div>
                     <div class="line">l'envoy, no l'envoy; no salve, sir, but a plantain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">By virtue, thou enforcest laughter; thy silly</div>
                     <div class="line">thought my spleen; the heaving of my lungs provokes</div>
                     <div class="line">me to ridiculous smiling. O, pardon me, my stars!</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth the inconsiderate take salve for l'envoy, and</div>
                     <div class="line">the word l'envoy for a salve?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Do the wise think them other? is not l'envoy a salve?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, page: it is an epilogue or discourse, to make plain</div>
                     <div class="line">Some obscure precedence that hath tofore been sain.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will example it:</div>
                     <div class="line">The fox, the ape, and the humble-bee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were still at odds, being but three.</div>
                     <div class="line">There's the moral. Now the l'envoy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will add the l'envoy. Say the moral again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The fox, the ape, and the humble-bee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were still at odds, being but three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Until the goose came out of door,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stay'd the odds by adding four.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now will I begin your moral, and do you follow with</div>
                     <div class="line">my l'envoy.</div>
                     <div class="line">The fox, the ape, and the humble-bee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were still at odds, being but three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Until the goose came out of door,</div>
                     <div class="line">Staying the odds by adding four.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A good l'envoy, ending in the goose: would you</div>
                     <div class="line">desire more?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">The boy hath sold him a bargain, a goose, that's flat.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, your pennyworth is good, an your goose be fat.</div>
                     <div class="line">To sell a bargain well is as cunning as fast and loose:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me see; a fat l'envoy; ay, that's a fat goose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, come hither. How did this argument begin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">By saying that a costard was broken in a shin.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then call'd you for the l'envoy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">True, and I for a plantain: thus came your</div>
                     <div class="line">argument in;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then the boy's fat l'envoy, the goose that you bought;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he ended the market.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me; how was there a costard broken in a shin?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will tell you sensibly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast no feeling of it, Moth: I will speak that l'envoy:</div>
                     <div class="line">I Costard, running out, that was safely within,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fell over the threshold and broke my shin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">We will talk no more of this matter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Till there be more matter in the shin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah Costard, I will enfranchise thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O, marry me to one Frances: I smell some l'envoy,</div>
                     <div class="line">some goose, in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">By my sweet soul, I mean setting thee at liberty,</div>
                     <div class="line">enfreedoming thy person; thou wert immured,</div>
                     <div class="line">restrained, captivated, bound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">True, true; and now you will be my purgation and let me loose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I give thee thy liberty, set thee from durance; and,</div>
                     <div class="line">in lieu thereof, impose on thee nothing but this:</div>
                     <div class="line">bear this significant</div>
                     <p>Giving a letter</p>
                     <div class="line">to the country maid Jaquenetta:</div>
                     <div class="line">there is remuneration; for the best ward of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">honour is rewarding my dependents. Moth, follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Like the sequel, I. Signior Costard, adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My sweet ounce of man's flesh! my incony Jew!</div>
                     <p>Exit MOTH</p>
                     <div class="line">Now will I look to his remuneration. Remuneration!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that's the Latin word for three farthings: three</div>
                     <div class="line">farthings--remuneration.--'What's the price of this</div>
                     <div class="line">inkle?'--'One penny.'--'No, I'll give you a</div>
                     <div class="line">remuneration:' why, it carries it. Remuneration!</div>
                     <div class="line">why, it is a fairer name than French crown. I will</div>
                     <div class="line">never buy and sell out of this word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BIRON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my good knave Costard! exceedingly well met.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, how much carnation ribbon may a man</div>
                     <div class="line">buy for a remuneration?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">What is a remuneration?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, halfpenny farthing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then, three-farthing worth of silk.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank your worship: God be wi' you!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, slave; I must employ thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou wilt win my favour, good my knave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do one thing for me that I shall entreat.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">When would you have it done, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This afternoon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will do it, sir: fare you well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou knowest not what it is.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall know, sir, when I have done it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, villain, thou must know first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I will come to your worship to-morrow morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">It must be done this afternoon.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hark, slave, it is but this:</div>
                     <div class="line">The princess comes to hunt here in the park,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in her train there is a gentle lady;</div>
                     <div class="line">When tongues speak sweetly, then they name her name,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Rosaline they call her: ask for her;</div>
                     <div class="line">And to her white hand see thou do commend</div>
                     <div class="line">This seal'd-up counsel. There's thy guerdon; go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Giving him a shilling</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Gardon, O sweet gardon! better than remuneration,</div>
                     <div class="line">a'leven-pence farthing better: most sweet gardon! I</div>
                     <div class="line">will do it sir, in print. Gardon! Remuneration!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">And I, forsooth, in love! I, that have been love's whip;</div>
                     <div class="line">A very beadle to a humorous sigh;</div>
                     <div class="line">A critic, nay, a night-watch constable;</div>
                     <div class="line">A domineering pedant o'er the boy;</div>
                     <div class="line">Than whom no mortal so magnificent!</div>
                     <div class="line">This whimpled, whining, purblind, wayward boy;</div>
                     <div class="line">This senior-junior, giant-dwarf, Dan Cupid;</div>
                     <div class="line">Regent of love-rhymes, lord of folded arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">The anointed sovereign of sighs and groans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Liege of all loiterers and malcontents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dread prince of plackets, king of codpieces,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sole imperator and great general</div>
                     <div class="line">Of trotting 'paritors:--O my little heart:--</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to be a corporal of his field,</div>
                     <div class="line">And wear his colours like a tumbler's hoop!</div>
                     <div class="line">What, I! I love! I sue! I seek a wife!</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman, that is like a German clock,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still a-repairing, ever out of frame,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never going aright, being a watch,</div>
                     <div class="line">But being watch'd that it may still go right!</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, to be perjured, which is worst of all;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, among three, to love the worst of all;</div>
                     <div class="line">A wightly wanton with a velvet brow,</div>
                     <div class="line">With two pitch-balls stuck in her face for eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and by heaven, one that will do the deed</div>
                     <div class="line">Though Argus were her eunuch and her guard:</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to sigh for her! to watch for her!</div>
                     <div class="line">To pray for her! Go to; it is a plague</div>
                     <div class="line">That Cupid will impose for my neglect</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his almighty dreadful little might.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will love, write, sigh, pray, sue and groan:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some men must love my lady and some Joan.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCESS, and her train, a Forester,
BOYET, ROSALINE, MARIA, and KATHARINE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Was that the king, that spurred his horse so hard</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the steep uprising of the hill?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not; but I think it was not he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoe'er a' was, a' show'd a mounting mind.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, lords, to-day we shall have our dispatch:</div>
                     <div class="line">On Saturday we will return to France.</div>
