                     <div class="line">Then, forester, my friend, where is the bush</div>
                     <div class="line">That we must stand and play the murderer in?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">Hereby, upon the edge of yonder coppice;</div>
                     <div class="line">A stand where you may make the fairest shoot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank my beauty, I am fair that shoot,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereupon thou speak'st the fairest shoot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, madam, for I meant not so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What, what? first praise me and again say no?</div>
                     <div class="line">O short-lived pride! Not fair? alack for woe!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, madam, fair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, never paint me now:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where fair is not, praise cannot mend the brow.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, good my glass, take this for telling true:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair payment for foul words is more than due.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Forester</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but fair is that which you inherit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">See see, my beauty will be saved by merit!</div>
                     <div class="line">O heresy in fair, fit for these days!</div>
                     <div class="line">A giving hand, though foul, shall have fair praise.</div>
                     <div class="line">But come, the bow: now mercy goes to kill,</div>
                     <div class="line">And shooting well is then accounted ill.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus will I save my credit in the shoot:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not wounding, pity would not let me do't;</div>
                     <div class="line">If wounding, then it was to show my skill,</div>
                     <div class="line">That more for praise than purpose meant to kill.</div>
                     <div class="line">And out of question so it is sometimes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Glory grows guilty of detested crimes,</div>
                     <div class="line">When, for fame's sake, for praise, an outward part,</div>
                     <div class="line">We bend to that the working of the heart;</div>
                     <div class="line">As I for praise alone now seek to spill</div>
                     <div class="line">The poor deer's blood, that my heart means no ill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not curst wives hold that self-sovereignty</div>
                     <div class="line">Only for praise sake, when they strive to be</div>
                     <div class="line">Lords o'er their lords?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Only for praise: and praise we may afford</div>
                     <div class="line">To any lady that subdues a lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes a member of the commonwealth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">God dig-you-den all! Pray you, which is the head lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt know her, fellow, by the rest that have no heads.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the greatest lady, the highest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">The thickest and the tallest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">The thickest and the tallest! it is so; truth is truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">An your waist, mistress, were as slender as my wit,</div>
                     <div class="line">One o' these maids' girdles for your waist should be fit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not you the chief woman? you are the thickest here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What's your will, sir? what's your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a letter from Monsieur Biron to one Lady Rosaline.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">O, thy letter, thy letter! he's a good friend of mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand aside, good bearer. Boyet, you can carve;</div>
                     <div class="line">Break up this capon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am bound to serve.</div>
                     <div class="line">This letter is mistook, it importeth none here;</div>
                     <div class="line">It is writ to Jaquenetta.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">We will read it, I swear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Break the neck of the wax, and every one give ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Reads</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">'By heaven, that thou art fair, is most infallible;</div>
                     <div class="line">true, that thou art beauteous; truth itself, that</div>
                     <div class="line">thou art lovely. More fairer than fair, beautiful</div>
                     <div class="line">than beauteous, truer than truth itself, have</div>
                     <div class="line">commiseration on thy heroical vassal! The</div>
                     <div class="line">magnanimous and most illustrate king Cophetua set</div>
                     <div class="line">eye upon the pernicious and indubitate beggar</div>
                     <div class="line">Zenelophon; and he it was that might rightly say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Veni, vidi, vici; which to annothanize in the</div>
                     <div class="line">vulgar,--O base and obscure vulgar!--videlicet, He</div>
                     <div class="line">came, saw, and overcame: he came, one; saw two;</div>
                     <div class="line">overcame, three. Who came? the king: why did he</div>
                     <div class="line">come? to see: why did he see? to overcome: to</div>
                     <div class="line">whom came he? to the beggar: what saw he? the</div>
                     <div class="line">beggar: who overcame he? the beggar. The</div>
                     <div class="line">conclusion is victory: on whose side? the king's.</div>
                     <div class="line">The captive is enriched: on whose side? the</div>
                     <div class="line">beggar's. The catastrophe is a nuptial: on whose</div>
                     <div class="line">side? the king's: no, on both in one, or one in</div>
                     <div class="line">both. I am the king; for so stands the comparison:</div>
                     <div class="line">thou the beggar; for so witnesseth thy lowliness.</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I command thy love? I may: shall I enforce</div>
                     <div class="line">thy love? I could: shall I entreat thy love? I</div>
                     <div class="line">will. What shalt thou exchange for rags? robes;</div>
                     <div class="line">for tittles? titles; for thyself? me. Thus,</div>
                     <div class="line">expecting thy reply, I profane my lips on thy foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">my eyes on thy picture. and my heart on thy every</div>
                     <div class="line">part. Thine, in the dearest design of industry,</div>
                     <div class="line">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus dost thou hear the Nemean lion roar</div>
                     <div class="line">'Gainst thee, thou lamb, that standest as his prey.</div>
                     <div class="line">Submissive fall his princely feet before,</div>
                     <div class="line">And he from forage will incline to play:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if thou strive, poor soul, what art thou then?</div>
                     <div class="line">Food for his rage, repasture for his den.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">What plume of feathers is he that indited this letter?</div>
                     <div class="line">What vane? what weathercock? did you ever hear better?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">I am much deceived but I remember the style.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Else your memory is bad, going o'er it erewhile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">This Armado is a Spaniard, that keeps here in court;</div>
                     <div class="line">A phantasime, a Monarcho, and one that makes sport</div>
                     <div class="line">To the prince and his bookmates.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou fellow, a word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who gave thee this letter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I told you; my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom shouldst thou give it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">From my lord to my lady.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">From which lord to which lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">From my lord Biron, a good master of mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">To a lady of France that he call'd Rosaline.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast mistaken his letter. Come, lords, away.</div>
                     <p>To ROSALINE</p>
                     <div class="line">Here, sweet, put up this: 'twill be thine another day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt PRINCESS and train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is the suitor? who is the suitor?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I teach you to know?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, my continent of beauty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, she that bears the bow.</div>
                     <div class="line">Finely put off!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">My lady goes to kill horns; but, if thou marry,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang me by the neck, if horns that year miscarry.</div>
                     <div class="line">Finely put on!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, then, I am the shooter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">And who is your deer?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">If we choose by the horns, yourself come not near.</div>
                     <div class="line">Finely put on, indeed!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You still wrangle with her, Boyet, and she strikes</div>
                     <div class="line">at the brow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">But she herself is hit lower: have I hit her now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I come upon thee with an old saying, that was</div>
                     <div class="line">a man when King Pepin of France was a little boy, as</div>
                     <div class="line">touching the hit it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">So I may answer thee with one as old, that was a</div>
                     <div class="line">woman when Queen Guinover of Britain was a little</div>
                     <div class="line">wench, as touching the hit it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not hit it, hit it, hit it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not hit it, my good man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">An I cannot, cannot, cannot,</div>
                     <div class="line">An I cannot, another can.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt ROSALINE and KATHARINE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">By my troth, most pleasant: how both did fit it!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A mark marvellous well shot, for they both did hit it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">A mark! O, mark but that mark! A mark, says my lady!</div>
                     <div class="line">Let the mark have a prick in't, to mete at, if it may be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Wide o' the bow hand! i' faith, your hand is out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, a' must shoot nearer, or he'll ne'er hit the clout.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">An if my hand be out, then belike your hand is in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Then will she get the upshoot by cleaving the pin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, come, you talk greasily; your lips grow foul.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">She's too hard for you at pricks, sir: challenge her to bowl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear too much rubbing. Good night, my good owl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt BOYET and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">By my soul, a swain! a most simple clown!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, Lord, how the ladies and I have put him down!</div>
                     <div class="line">O' my troth, most sweet jests! most incony</div>
                     <div class="line">vulgar wit!</div>
                     <div class="line">When it comes so smoothly off, so obscenely, as it</div>
                     <div class="line">were, so fit.</div>
                     <div class="line">Armado o' th' one side,--O, a most dainty man!</div>
                     <div class="line">To see him walk before a lady and to bear her fan!</div>
                     <div class="line">To see him kiss his hand! and how most sweetly a'</div>
                     <div class="line">will swear!</div>
                     <div class="line">And his page o' t' other side, that handful of wit!</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, heavens, it is a most pathetical nit!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sola, sola!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Shout within</p>
               <p>Exit COSTARD, running</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, and DULL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Very reverend sport, truly; and done in the testimony</div>
                     <div class="line">of a good conscience.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">The deer was, as you know, sanguis, in blood; ripe</div>
                     <div class="line">as the pomewater, who now hangeth like a jewel in</div>
                     <div class="line">the ear of caelo, the sky, the welkin, the heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">and anon falleth like a crab on the face of terra,</div>
                     <div class="line">the soil, the land, the earth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Truly, Master Holofernes, the epithets are sweetly</div>
                     <div class="line">varied, like a scholar at the least: but, sir, I</div>
                     <div class="line">assure ye, it was a buck of the first head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Nathaniel, haud credo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twas not a haud credo; 'twas a pricket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most barbarous intimation! yet a kind of</div>
                     <div class="line">insinuation, as it were, in via, in way, of</div>
                     <div class="line">explication; facere, as it were, replication, or</div>
                     <div class="line">rather, ostentare, to show, as it were, his</div>
                     <div class="line">inclination, after his undressed, unpolished,</div>
                     <div class="line">uneducated, unpruned, untrained, or rather,</div>
                     <div class="line">unlettered, or ratherest, unconfirmed fashion, to</div>
                     <div class="line">insert again my haud credo for a deer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">I said the deer was not a haud credo; twas a pricket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Twice-sod simplicity, his coctus!</div>
                     <div class="line">O thou monster Ignorance, how deformed dost thou look!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, he hath never fed of the dainties that are bred</div>
                     <div class="line">in a book; he hath not eat paper, as it were; he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath not drunk ink: his intellect is not</div>
                     <div class="line">replenished; he is only an animal, only sensible in</div>
                     <div class="line">the duller parts:</div>
                     <div class="line">And such barren plants are set before us, that we</div>
                     <div class="line">thankful should be,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we of taste and feeling are, for those parts that</div>
                     <div class="line">do fructify in us more than he.</div>
                     <div class="line">For as it would ill become me to be vain, indiscreet, or a fool,</div>
                     <div class="line">So were there a patch set on learning, to see him in a school:</div>
                     <div class="line">But omne bene, say I; being of an old father's mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Many can brook the weather that love not the wind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">You two are book-men: can you tell me by your wit</div>
                     <div class="line">What was a month old at Cain's birth, that's not five</div>
                     <div class="line">weeks old as yet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Dictynna, goodman Dull; Dictynna, goodman Dull.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">What is Dictynna?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">A title to Phoebe, to Luna, to the moon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon was a month old when Adam was no more,</div>
                     <div class="line">And raught not to five weeks when he came to</div>
                     <div class="line">five-score.</div>
                     <div class="line">The allusion holds in the exchange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true indeed; the collusion holds in the exchange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">God comfort thy capacity! I say, the allusion holds</div>
                     <div class="line">in the exchange.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">And I say, the pollusion holds in the exchange; for</div>
                     <div class="line">the moon is never but a month old: and I say beside</div>
                     <div class="line">that, 'twas a pricket that the princess killed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Nathaniel, will you hear an extemporal epitaph</div>
                     <div class="line">on the death of the deer? And, to humour the</div>
                     <div class="line">ignorant, call I the deer the princess killed a pricket.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Perge, good Master Holofernes, perge; so it shall</div>
                     <div class="line">please you to abrogate scurrility.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will something affect the letter, for it argues facility.</div>
                     <div class="line">The preyful princess pierced and prick'd a pretty</div>
                     <div class="line">pleasing pricket;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some say a sore; but not a sore, till now made</div>
                     <div class="line">sore with shooting.</div>
                     <div class="line">The dogs did yell: put L to sore, then sorel jumps</div>
                     <div class="line">from thicket;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or pricket sore, or else sorel; the people fall a-hooting.</div>
                     <div class="line">If sore be sore, then L to sore makes fifty sores</div>
                     <div class="line">one sorel.</div>
                     <div class="line">Of one sore I an hundred make by adding but one more L.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">A rare talent!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  If a talent be a claw, look how he claws</div>
                     <div class="line">him with a talent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">This is a gift that I have, simple, simple; a</div>
                     <div class="line">foolish extravagant spirit, full of forms, figures,</div>
                     <div class="line">shapes, objects, ideas, apprehensions, motions,</div>
                     <div class="line">revolutions: these are begot in the ventricle of</div>
                     <div class="line">memory, nourished in the womb of pia mater, and</div>
                     <div class="line">delivered upon the mellowing of occasion. But the</div>
                     <div class="line">gift is good in those in whom it is acute, and I am</div>
                     <div class="line">thankful for it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I praise the Lord for you; and so may my</div>
                     <div class="line">parishioners; for their sons are well tutored by</div>
                     <div class="line">you, and their daughters profit very greatly under</div>
                     <div class="line">you: you are a good member of the commonwealth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Mehercle, if their sons be ingenuous, they shall</div>
                     <div class="line">want no instruction; if their daughters be capable,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will put it to them: but vir sapit qui pauca</div>
                     <div class="line">loquitur; a soul feminine saluteth us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JAQUENETTA and COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">God give you good morrow, master Parson.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Parson, quasi pers-on. An if one should be</div>
                     <div class="line">pierced, which is the one?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, master schoolmaster, he that is likest to a hogshead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Piercing a hogshead! a good lustre of conceit in a</div>
                     <div class="line">tuft of earth; fire enough for a flint, pearl enough</div>
                     <div class="line">for a swine: 'tis pretty; it is well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good master Parson, be so good as read me this</div>
                     <div class="line">letter: it was given me by Costard, and sent me</div>
                     <div class="line">from Don Armado: I beseech you, read it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Fauste, precor gelida quando pecus omne sub umbra</div>
                     <div class="line">Ruminat,--and so forth. Ah, good old Mantuan! I</div>
                     <div class="line">may speak of thee as the traveller doth of Venice;</div>
                     <div class="line">Venetia, Venetia,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chi non ti vede non ti pretia.</div>
                     <div class="line">Old Mantuan, old Mantuan! who understandeth thee</div>
                     <div class="line">not, loves thee not. Ut, re, sol, la, mi, fa.</div>
                     <div class="line">Under pardon, sir, what are the contents? or rather,</div>
                     <div class="line">as Horace says in his--What, my soul, verses?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, and very learned.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me hear a staff, a stanze, a verse; lege, domine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">If love make me forsworn, how shall I swear to love?</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, never faith could hold, if not to beauty vow'd!</div>
                     <div class="line">Though to myself forsworn, to thee I'll faithful prove:</div>
                     <div class="line">Those thoughts to me were oaks, to thee like</div>
                     <div class="line">osiers bow'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Study his bias leaves and makes his book thine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where all those pleasures live that art would</div>
                     <div class="line">comprehend:</div>
                     <div class="line">If knowledge be the mark, to know thee shall suffice;</div>
                     <div class="line">Well learned is that tongue that well can thee commend,</div>
                     <div class="line">All ignorant that soul that sees thee without wonder;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is to me some praise that I thy parts admire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy eye Jove's lightning bears, thy voice his dreadful thunder,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which not to anger bent, is music and sweet fire.</div>
                     <div class="line">Celestial as thou art, O, pardon, love, this wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sings heaven's praise with such an earthly tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">You find not the apostraphas, and so miss the</div>
                     <div class="line">accent: let me supervise the canzonet. Here are</div>
                     <div class="line">only numbers ratified; but, for the elegancy,</div>
                     <div class="line">facility, and golden cadence of poesy, caret.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ovidius Naso was the man: and why, indeed, Naso,</div>
                     <div class="line">but for smelling out the odouriferous flowers of</div>
                     <div class="line">fancy, the jerks of invention? Imitari is nothing:</div>
                     <div class="line">so doth the hound his master, the ape his keeper,</div>
                     <div class="line">the tired horse his rider. But, damosella virgin,</div>
                     <div class="line">was this directed to you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, from one Monsieur Biron, one of the strange</div>
                     <div class="line">queen's lords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will overglance the superscript: 'To the</div>
                     <div class="line">snow-white hand of the most beauteous Lady</div>
                     <div class="line">Rosaline.' I will look again on the intellect of</div>
                     <div class="line">the letter, for the nomination of the party writing</div>
                     <div class="line">to the person written unto: 'Your ladyship's in all</div>
                     <div class="line">desired employment, BIRON.' Sir Nathaniel, this</div>
                     <div class="line">Biron is one of the votaries with the king; and here</div>
                     <div class="line">he hath framed a letter to a sequent of the stranger</div>
                     <div class="line">queen's, which accidentally, or by the way of</div>
                     <div class="line">progression, hath miscarried. Trip and go, my</div>
                     <div class="line">sweet; deliver this paper into the royal hand of the</div>
                     <div class="line">king: it may concern much. Stay not thy</div>
                     <div class="line">compliment; I forgive thy duty; adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Costard, go with me. Sir, God save your life!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Have with thee, my girl.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt COSTARD and JAQUENETTA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, you have done this in the fear of God, very</div>
                     <div class="line">religiously; and, as a certain father saith,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir tell me not of the father; I do fear colourable</div>
                     <div class="line">colours. But to return to the verses: did they</div>
                     <div class="line">please you, Sir Nathaniel?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Marvellous well for the pen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do dine to-day at the father's of a certain pupil</div>
                     <div class="line">of mine; where, if, before repast, it shall please</div>
                     <div class="line">you to gratify the table with a grace, I will, on my</div>
                     <div class="line">privilege I have with the parents of the foresaid</div>
                     <div class="line">child or pupil, undertake your ben venuto; where I</div>
                     <div class="line">will prove those verses to be very unlearned,</div>
                     <div class="line">neither savouring of poetry, wit, nor invention: I</div>
                     <div class="line">beseech your society.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">And thank you too; for society, saith the text, is</div>
                     <div class="line">the happiness of life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">And, certes, the text most infallibly concludes it.</div>
                     <p>To DULL</p>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I do invite you too; you shall not</div>
                     <div class="line">say me nay: pauca verba. Away! the gentles are at</div>
                     <div class="line">their game, and we will to our recreation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BIRON, with a paper</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">The king he is hunting the deer; I am coursing</div>
                     <div class="line">myself: they have pitched a toil; I am toiling in</div>
                     <div class="line">a pitch,--pitch that defiles: defile! a foul</div>
                     <div class="line">word. Well, set thee down, sorrow! for so they say</div>
                     <div class="line">the fool said, and so say I, and I the fool: well</div>
                     <div class="line">proved, wit! By the Lord, this love is as mad as</div>
                     <div class="line">Ajax: it kills sheep; it kills me, I a sheep:</div>
                     <div class="line">well proved again o' my side! I will not love: if</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, hang me; i' faith, I will not. O, but her</div>
                     <div class="line">eye,--by this light, but for her eye, I would not</div>
                     <div class="line">love her; yes, for her two eyes. Well, I do nothing</div>
                     <div class="line">in the world but lie, and lie in my throat. By</div>
                     <div class="line">heaven, I do love: and it hath taught me to rhyme</div>
                     <div class="line">and to be melancholy; and here is part of my rhyme,</div>
                     <div class="line">and here my melancholy. Well, she hath one o' my</div>
                     <div class="line">sonnets already: the clown bore it, the fool sent</div>
                     <div class="line">it, and the lady hath it: sweet clown, sweeter</div>
                     <div class="line">fool, sweetest lady! By the world, I would not care</div>
                     <div class="line">a pin, if the other three were in. Here comes one</div>
                     <div class="line">with a paper: God give him grace to groan!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Stands aside</p>
               <p>Enter FERDINAND, with a paper</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Shot, by heaven! Proceed, sweet Cupid:</div>
                     <div class="line">thou hast thumped him with thy bird-bolt under the</div>
                     <div class="line">left pap. In faith, secrets!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">So sweet a kiss the golden sun gives not</div>
                     <div class="line">To those fresh morning drops upon the rose,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thy eye-beams, when their fresh rays have smote</div>
                     <div class="line">The night of dew that on my cheeks down flows:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor shines the silver moon one half so bright</div>
                     <div class="line">Through the transparent bosom of the deep,</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth thy face through tears of mine give light;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shinest in every tear that I do weep:</div>
                     <div class="line">No drop but as a coach doth carry thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">So ridest thou triumphing in my woe.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do but behold the tears that swell in me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they thy glory through my grief will show:</div>
                     <div class="line">But do not love thyself; then thou wilt keep</div>
                     <div class="line">My tears for glasses, and still make me weep.</div>
                     <div class="line">O queen of queens! how far dost thou excel,</div>
                     <div class="line">No thought can think, nor tongue of mortal tell.</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall she know my griefs? I'll drop the paper:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet leaves, shade folly. Who is he comes here?</div>
                     <p>Steps aside</p>
                     <div class="line">What, Longaville! and reading! listen, ear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, in thy likeness, one more fool appear!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LONGAVILLE, with a paper</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me, I am forsworn!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, he comes in like a perjure, wearing papers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">In love, I hope: sweet fellowship in shame!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">One drunkard loves another of the name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I the first that have been perjured so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I could put thee in comfort. Not by two that I know:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou makest the triumviry, the corner-cap of society,</div>
                     <div class="line">The shape of Love's Tyburn that hangs up simplicity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear these stubborn lines lack power to move:</div>
                     <div class="line">O sweet Maria, empress of my love!</div>
                     <div class="line">These numbers will I tear, and write in prose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, rhymes are guards on wanton Cupid's hose:</div>
                     <div class="line">Disfigure not his slop.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">This same shall go.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">Did not the heavenly rhetoric of thine eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Gainst whom the world cannot hold argument,</div>
                     <div class="line">Persuade my heart to this false perjury?</div>
                     <div class="line">Vows for thee broke deserve not punishment.</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman I forswore; but I will prove,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou being a goddess, I forswore not thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">My vow was earthly, thou a heavenly love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grace being gain'd cures all disgrace in me.</div>
                     <div class="line">Vows are but breath, and breath a vapour is:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then thou, fair sun, which on my earth dost shine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Exhalest this vapour-vow; in thee it is:</div>
                     <div class="line">If broken then, it is no fault of mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">If by me broke, what fool is not so wise</div>
                     <div class="line">To lose an oath to win a paradise?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the liver-vein, which makes flesh a deity,</div>
                     <div class="line">A green goose a goddess: pure, pure idolatry.</div>
                     <div class="line">God amend us, God amend! we are much out o' the way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">By whom shall I send this?--Company! stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Steps aside</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">All hid, all hid; an old infant play.</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a demigod here sit I in the sky.</div>
                     <div class="line">And wretched fools' secrets heedfully o'ereye.</div>
                     <div class="line">More sacks to the mill! O heavens, I have my wish!</div>
                     <p>Enter DUMAIN, with a paper</p>
                     <div class="line">Dumain transform'd! four woodcocks in a dish!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">O most divine Kate!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">O most profane coxcomb!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, the wonder in a mortal eye!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">By earth, she is not, corporal, there you lie.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Her amber hair for foul hath amber quoted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">An amber-colour'd raven was well noted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">As upright as the cedar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Stoop, I say;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her shoulder is with child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">As fair as day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, as some days; but then no sun must shine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">O that I had my wish!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">And I had mine!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And I mine too, good Lord!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, so I had mine: is not that a good word?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">I would forget her; but a fever she</div>
                     <div class="line">Reigns in my blood and will remember'd be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">A fever in your blood! why, then incision</div>
                     <div class="line">Would let her out in saucers: sweet misprision!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Once more I'll read the ode that I have writ.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Once more I'll mark how love can vary wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Reads</span>
                     </div>
                     <div class="line">On a day--alack the day!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Love, whose month is ever May,</div>
                     <div class="line">Spied a blossom passing fair</div>
                     <div class="line">Playing in the wanton air:</div>
                     <div class="line">Through the velvet leaves the wind,</div>
                     <div class="line">All unseen, can passage find;</div>
                     <div class="line">That the lover, sick to death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wish himself the heaven's breath.</div>
                     <div class="line">Air, quoth he, thy cheeks may blow;</div>
                     <div class="line">Air, would I might triumph so!</div>
                     <div class="line">But, alack, my hand is sworn</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er to pluck thee from thy thorn;</div>
                     <div class="line">Vow, alack, for youth unmeet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Youth so apt to pluck a sweet!</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not call it sin in me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I am forsworn for thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou for whom Jove would swear</div>
                     <div class="line">Juno but an Ethiope were;</div>
                     <div class="line">And deny himself for Jove,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning mortal for thy love.</div>
                     <div class="line">This will I send, and something else more plain,</div>
                     <div class="line">That shall express my true love's fasting pain.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, would the king, Biron, and Longaville,</div>
                     <div class="line">Were lovers too! Ill, to example ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would from my forehead wipe a perjured note;</div>
                     <div class="line">For none offend where all alike do dote.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Advancing</span>  Dumain, thy love is far from charity.</div>
                     <div class="line">You may look pale, but I should blush, I know,</div>
                     <div class="line">To be o'erheard and taken napping so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Advancing</span>  Come, sir, you blush; as his your case is such;</div>
                     <div class="line">You chide at him, offending twice as much;</div>
                     <div class="line">You do not love Maria; Longaville</div>
                     <div class="line">Did never sonnet for her sake compile,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor never lay his wreathed arms athwart</div>
                     <div class="line">His loving bosom to keep down his heart.</div>
                     <div class="line">I have been closely shrouded in this bush</div>
                     <div class="line">And mark'd you both and for you both did blush:</div>
                     <div class="line">I heard your guilty rhymes, observed your fashion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw sighs reek from you, noted well your passion:</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me! says one; O Jove! the other cries;</div>
                     <div class="line">One, her hairs were gold, crystal the other's eyes:</div>
                     <p>To LONGAVILLE</p>
                     <div class="line">You would for paradise break faith, and troth;</div>
                     <p>To DUMAIN</p>
                     <div class="line">And Jove, for your love, would infringe an oath.</div>
                     <div class="line">What will Biron say when that he shall hear</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith so infringed, which such zeal did swear?</div>
                     <div class="line">How will he scorn! how will he spend his wit!</div>
                     <div class="line">How will he triumph, leap and laugh at it!</div>
                     <div class="line">For all the wealth that ever I did see,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not have him know so much by me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Now step I forth to whip hypocrisy.</div>
                     <p>Advancing</p>
                     <div class="line">Ah, good my liege, I pray thee, pardon me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Good heart, what grace hast thou, thus to reprove</div>
                     <div class="line">These worms for loving, that art most in love?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your eyes do make no coaches; in your tears</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no certain princess that appears;</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll not be perjured, 'tis a hateful thing;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tush, none but minstrels like of sonneting!</div>
                     <div class="line">But are you not ashamed? nay, are you not,</div>
                     <div class="line">All three of you, to be thus much o'ershot?</div>
                     <div class="line">You found his mote; the king your mote did see;</div>
                     <div class="line">But I a beam do find in each of three.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, what a scene of foolery have I seen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of sighs, of groans, of sorrow and of teen!</div>
                     <div class="line">O me, with what strict patience have I sat,</div>
                     <div class="line">To see a king transformed to a gnat!</div>
                     <div class="line">To see great Hercules whipping a gig,</div>
                     <div class="line">And profound Solomon to tune a jig,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Nestor play at push-pin with the boys,</div>
                     <div class="line">And critic Timon laugh at idle toys!</div>
                     <div class="line">Where lies thy grief, O, tell me, good Dumain?</div>
                     <div class="line">And gentle Longaville, where lies thy pain?</div>
                     <div class="line">And where my liege's? all about the breast:</div>
                     <div class="line">A caudle, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Too bitter is thy jest.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are we betray'd thus to thy over-view?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Not you to me, but I betray'd by you:</div>
                     <div class="line">I, that am honest; I, that hold it sin</div>
                     <div class="line">To break the vow I am engaged in;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am betray'd, by keeping company</div>
                     <div class="line">With men like men of inconstancy.</div>
                     <div class="line">When shall you see me write a thing in rhyme?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or groan for love? or spend a minute's time</div>
                     <div class="line">In pruning me? When shall you hear that I</div>
                     <div class="line">Will praise a hand, a foot, a face, an eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">A gait, a state, a brow, a breast, a waist,</div>
                     <div class="line">A leg, a limb?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Soft! whither away so fast?</div>
                     <div class="line">A true man or a thief that gallops so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I post from love: good lover, let me go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JAQUENETTA and COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless the king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What present hast thou there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Some certain treason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What makes treason here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, it makes nothing, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">If it mar nothing neither,</div>
                     <div class="line">The treason and you go in peace away together.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech your grace, let this letter be read:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our parson misdoubts it; 'twas treason, he said.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Biron, read it over.</div>
                     <p>Giving him the paper</p>
                     <div class="line">Where hadst thou it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JAQUENETTA</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Costard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Where hadst thou it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Dun Adramadio, Dun Adramadio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>BIRON tears the letter</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">How now! what is in you? why dost thou tear it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">A toy, my liege, a toy: your grace needs not fear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">It did move him to passion, and therefore let's hear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">It is Biron's writing, and here is his name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Gathering up the pieces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To COSTARD</span>  Ah, you whoreson loggerhead! you were</div>
                     <div class="line">born to do me shame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Guilty, my lord, guilty! I confess, I confess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">That you three fools lack'd me fool to make up the mess:</div>
                     <div class="line">He, he, and you, and you, my liege, and I,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are pick-purses in love, and we deserve to die.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, dismiss this audience, and I shall tell you more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Now the number is even.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
