                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">True, true; we are four.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will these turtles be gone?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, sirs; away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Walk aside the true folk, and let the traitors stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt COSTARD and JAQUENETTA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lords, sweet lovers, O, let us embrace!</div>
                     <div class="line">As true we are as flesh and blood can be:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sea will ebb and flow, heaven show his face;</div>
                     <div class="line">Young blood doth not obey an old decree:</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot cross the cause why we were born;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore of all hands must we be forsworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What, did these rent lines show some love of thine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Did they, quoth you? Who sees the heavenly Rosaline,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, like a rude and savage man of Inde,</div>
                     <div class="line">At the first opening of the gorgeous east,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bows not his vassal head and strucken blind</div>
                     <div class="line">Kisses the base ground with obedient breast?</div>
                     <div class="line">What peremptory eagle-sighted eye</div>
                     <div class="line">Dares look upon the heaven of her brow,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is not blinded by her majesty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">What zeal, what fury hath inspired thee now?</div>
                     <div class="line">My love, her mistress, is a gracious moon;</div>
                     <div class="line">She an attending star, scarce seen a light.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">My eyes are then no eyes, nor I Biron:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, but for my love, day would turn to night!</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all complexions the cull'd sovereignty</div>
                     <div class="line">Do meet, as at a fair, in her fair cheek,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where several worthies make one dignity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where nothing wants that want itself doth seek.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me the flourish of all gentle tongues,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, painted rhetoric! O, she needs it not:</div>
                     <div class="line">To things of sale a seller's praise belongs,</div>
                     <div class="line">She passes praise; then praise too short doth blot.</div>
                     <div class="line">A wither'd hermit, five-score winters worn,</div>
                     <div class="line">Might shake off fifty, looking in her eye:</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauty doth varnish age, as if new-born,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gives the crutch the cradle's infancy:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, 'tis the sun that maketh all things shine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, thy love is black as ebony.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is ebony like her? O wood divine!</div>
                     <div class="line">A wife of such wood were felicity.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, who can give an oath? where is a book?</div>
                     <div class="line">That I may swear beauty doth beauty lack,</div>
                     <div class="line">If that she learn not of her eye to look:</div>
                     <div class="line">No face is fair that is not full so black.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">O paradox! Black is the badge of hell,</div>
                     <div class="line">The hue of dungeons and the suit of night;</div>
                     <div class="line">And beauty's crest becomes the heavens well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Devils soonest tempt, resembling spirits of light.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if in black my lady's brows be deck'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">It mourns that painting and usurping hair</div>
                     <div class="line">Should ravish doters with a false aspect;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore is she born to make black fair.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her favour turns the fashion of the days,</div>
                     <div class="line">For native blood is counted painting now;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore red, that would avoid dispraise,</div>
                     <div class="line">Paints itself black, to imitate her brow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">To look like her are chimney-sweepers black.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">And since her time are colliers counted bright.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And Ethiopes of their sweet complexion crack.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Dark needs no candles now, for dark is light.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Your mistresses dare never come in rain,</div>
                     <div class="line">For fear their colours should be wash'd away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twere good, yours did; for, sir, to tell you plain,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll find a fairer face not wash'd to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll prove her fair, or talk till doomsday here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">No devil will fright thee then so much as she.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">I never knew man hold vile stuff so dear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, here's thy love: my foot and her face see.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if the streets were paved with thine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her feet were much too dainty for such tread!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, vile! then, as she goes, what upward lies</div>
                     <div class="line">The street should see as she walk'd overhead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">But what of this? are we not all in love?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing so sure; and thereby all forsworn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Then leave this chat; and, good Biron, now prove</div>
                     <div class="line">Our loving lawful, and our faith not torn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, there; some flattery for this evil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, some authority how to proceed;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some tricks, some quillets, how to cheat the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Some salve for perjury.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis more than need.</div>
                     <div class="line">Have at you, then, affection's men at arms.</div>
                     <div class="line">Consider what you first did swear unto,</div>
                     <div class="line">To fast, to study, and to see no woman;</div>
                     <div class="line">Flat treason 'gainst the kingly state of youth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, can you fast? your stomachs are too young;</div>
                     <div class="line">And abstinence engenders maladies.</div>
                     <div class="line">And where that you have vow'd to study, lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">In that each of you have forsworn his book,</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you still dream and pore and thereon look?</div>
                     <div class="line">For when would you, my lord, or you, or you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have found the ground of study's excellence</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the beauty of a woman's face?</div>
                     <p>From women's eyes this doctrine I derive;
They are the ground, the books, the academes
From whence doth spring the true Promethean fire</p>
                     <div class="line">Why, universal plodding poisons up</div>
                     <div class="line">The nimble spirits in the arteries,</div>
                     <div class="line">As motion and long-during action tires</div>
                     <div class="line">The sinewy vigour of the traveller.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, for not looking on a woman's face,</div>
                     <div class="line">You have in that forsworn the use of eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">And study too, the causer of your vow;</div>
                     <div class="line">For where is any author in the world</div>
                     <div class="line">Teaches such beauty as a woman's eye?</div>
                     <div class="line">Learning is but an adjunct to ourself</div>
                     <div class="line">And where we are our learning likewise is:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then when ourselves we see in ladies' eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do we not likewise see our learning there?</div>
                     <div class="line">O, we have made a vow to study, lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in that vow we have forsworn our books.</div>
                     <div class="line">For when would you, my liege, or you, or you,</div>
                     <div class="line">In leaden contemplation have found out</div>
                     <div class="line">Such fiery numbers as the prompting eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Of beauty's tutors have enrich'd you with?</div>
                     <div class="line">Other slow arts entirely keep the brain;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, finding barren practisers,</div>
                     <div class="line">Scarce show a harvest of their heavy toil:</div>
                     <div class="line">But love, first learned in a lady's eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives not alone immured in the brain;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, with the motion of all elements,</div>
                     <div class="line">Courses as swift as thought in every power,</div>
                     <div class="line">And gives to every power a double power,</div>
                     <div class="line">Above their functions and their offices.</div>
                     <div class="line">It adds a precious seeing to the eye;</div>
                     <div class="line">A lover's eyes will gaze an eagle blind;</div>
                     <div class="line">A lover's ear will hear the lowest sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the suspicious head of theft is stopp'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Love's feeling is more soft and sensible</div>
                     <div class="line">Than are the tender horns of cockl'd snails;</div>
                     <div class="line">Love's tongue proves dainty Bacchus gross in taste:</div>
                     <div class="line">For valour, is not Love a Hercules,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still climbing trees in the Hesperides?</div>
                     <div class="line">Subtle as Sphinx; as sweet and musical</div>
                     <div class="line">As bright Apollo's lute, strung with his hair:</div>
                     <div class="line">And when Love speaks, the voice of all the gods</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes heaven drowsy with the harmony.</div>
                     <div class="line">Never durst poet touch a pen to write</div>
                     <div class="line">Until his ink were temper'd with Love's sighs;</div>
                     <div class="line">O, then his lines would ravish savage ears</div>
                     <div class="line">And plant in tyrants mild humility.</div>
                     <div class="line">From women's eyes this doctrine I derive:</div>
                     <div class="line">They sparkle still the right Promethean fire;</div>
                     <div class="line">They are the books, the arts, the academes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That show, contain and nourish all the world:</div>
                     <div class="line">Else none at all in ought proves excellent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then fools you were these women to forswear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or keeping what is sworn, you will prove fools.</div>
                     <div class="line">For wisdom's sake, a word that all men love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or for love's sake, a word that loves all men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or for men's sake, the authors of these women,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or women's sake, by whom we men are men,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let us once lose our oaths to find ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else we lose ourselves to keep our oaths.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is religion to be thus forsworn,</div>
                     <div class="line">For charity itself fulfills the law,</div>
                     <div class="line">And who can sever love from charity?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Cupid, then! and, soldiers, to the field!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Advance your standards, and upon them, lords;</div>
                     <div class="line">Pell-mell, down with them! but be first advised,</div>
                     <div class="line">In conflict that you get the sun of them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now to plain-dealing; lay these glozes by:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall we resolve to woo these girls of France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">And win them too: therefore let us devise</div>
                     <div class="line">Some entertainment for them in their tents.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">First, from the park let us conduct them thither;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then homeward every man attach the hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his fair mistress: in the afternoon</div>
                     <div class="line">We will with some strange pastime solace them,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as the shortness of the time can shape;</div>
                     <div class="line">For revels, dances, masks and merry hours</div>
                     <div class="line">Forerun fair Love, strewing her way with flowers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Away, away! no time shall be omitted</div>
                     <div class="line">That will betime, and may by us be fitted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Allons! allons! Sow'd cockle reap'd no corn;</div>
                     <div class="line">And justice always whirls in equal measure:</div>
                     <div class="line">Light wenches may prove plagues to men forsworn;</div>
                     <div class="line">If so, our copper buys no better treasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, and DULL</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Satis quod sufficit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">I praise God for you, sir: your reasons at dinner</div>
                     <div class="line">have been sharp and sententious; pleasant without</div>
                     <div class="line">scurrility, witty without affection, audacious without</div>
                     <div class="line">impudency, learned without opinion, and strange with-</div>
                     <div class="line">out heresy. I did converse this quondam day with</div>
                     <div class="line">a companion of the king's, who is intituled, nomi-</div>
                     <div class="line">nated, or called, Don Adriano de Armado.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Novi hominem tanquam te: his humour is lofty, his</div>
                     <div class="line">discourse peremptory, his tongue filed, his eye</div>
                     <div class="line">ambitious, his gait majestical, and his general</div>
                     <div class="line">behavior vain, ridiculous, and thrasonical. He is</div>
                     <div class="line">too picked, too spruce, too affected, too odd, as it</div>
                     <div class="line">were, too peregrinate, as I may call it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">A most singular and choice epithet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Draws out his table-book</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">He draweth out the thread of his verbosity finer</div>
                     <div class="line">than the staple of his argument. I abhor such</div>
                     <div class="line">fanatical phantasimes, such insociable and</div>
                     <div class="line">point-devise companions; such rackers of</div>
                     <div class="line">orthography, as to speak dout, fine, when he should</div>
                     <div class="line">say doubt; det, when he should pronounce debt,--d,</div>
                     <div class="line">e, b, t, not d, e, t: he clepeth a calf, cauf;</div>
                     <div class="line">half, hauf; neighbour vocatur nebor; neigh</div>
                     <div class="line">abbreviated ne. This is abhominable,--which he</div>
                     <div class="line">would call abbominable: it insinuateth me of</div>
                     <div class="line">insanie: anne intelligis, domine? to make frantic, lunatic.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Laus Deo, bene intelligo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Bon, bon, fort bon, Priscian! a little scratch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">'twill serve.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Videsne quis venit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Video, et gaudeo.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, MOTH, and COSTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Chirrah!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>To MOTH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Quare chirrah, not sirrah?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Men of peace, well encountered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most military sir, salutation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to COSTARD</span>  They have been at a great feast</div>
                     <div class="line">of languages, and stolen the scraps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O, they have lived long on the alms-basket of words.</div>
                     <div class="line">I marvel thy master hath not eaten thee for a word;</div>
                     <div class="line">for thou art not so long by the head as</div>
                     <div class="line">honorificabilitudinitatibus: thou art easier</div>
                     <div class="line">swallowed than a flap-dragon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace! the peal begins.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To HOLOFERNES</span>  Monsieur, are you not lettered?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, yes; he teaches boys the hornbook. What is a,</div>
                     <div class="line">b, spelt backward, with the horn on his head?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Ba, pueritia, with a horn added.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Ba, most silly sheep with a horn. You hear his learning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Quis, quis, thou consonant?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">The third of the five vowels, if you repeat them; or</div>
                     <div class="line">the fifth, if I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will repeat them,--a, e, i,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">The sheep: the other two concludes it,--o, u.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the salt wave of the Mediterraneum, a sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">touch, a quick venue of wit! snip, snap, quick and</div>
                     <div class="line">home! it rejoiceth my intellect: true wit!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Offered by a child to an old man; which is wit-old.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the figure? what is the figure?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Horns.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou disputest like an infant: go, whip thy gig.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Lend me your horn to make one, and I will whip about</div>
                     <div class="line">your infamy circum circa,--a gig of a cuckold's horn.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">An I had but one penny in the world, thou shouldst</div>
                     <div class="line">have it to buy gingerbread: hold, there is the very</div>
                     <div class="line">remuneration I had of thy master, thou halfpenny</div>
                     <div class="line">purse of wit, thou pigeon-egg of discretion. O, an</div>
                     <div class="line">the heavens were so pleased that thou wert but my</div>
                     <div class="line">bastard, what a joyful father wouldst thou make me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to; thou hast it ad dunghill, at the fingers'</div>
                     <div class="line">ends, as they say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I smell false Latin; dunghill for unguem.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Arts-man, preambulate, we will be singled from the</div>
                     <div class="line">barbarous. Do you not educate youth at the</div>
                     <div class="line">charge-house on the top of the mountain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Or mons, the hill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">At your sweet pleasure, for the mountain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, sans question.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, it is the king's most sweet pleasure and</div>
                     <div class="line">affection to congratulate the princess at her</div>
                     <div class="line">pavilion in the posteriors of this day, which the</div>
                     <div class="line">rude multitude call the afternoon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">The posterior of the day, most generous sir, is</div>
                     <div class="line">liable, congruent and measurable for the afternoon:</div>
                     <div class="line">the word is well culled, chose, sweet and apt, I do</div>
                     <div class="line">assure you, sir, I do assure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, the king is a noble gentleman, and my familiar,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do assure ye, very good friend: for what is</div>
                     <div class="line">inward between us, let it pass. I do beseech thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">remember thy courtesy; I beseech thee, apparel thy</div>
                     <div class="line">head: and among other important and most serious</div>
                     <div class="line">designs, and of great import indeed, too, but let</div>
                     <div class="line">that pass: for I must tell thee, it will please his</div>
                     <div class="line">grace, by the world, sometime to lean upon my poor</div>
                     <div class="line">shoulder, and with his royal finger, thus, dally</div>
                     <div class="line">with my excrement, with my mustachio; but, sweet</div>
                     <div class="line">heart, let that pass. By the world, I recount no</div>
                     <div class="line">fable: some certain special honours it pleaseth his</div>
                     <div class="line">greatness to impart to Armado, a soldier, a man of</div>
                     <div class="line">travel, that hath seen the world; but let that pass.</div>
                     <div class="line">The very all of all is,--but, sweet heart, I do</div>
                     <div class="line">implore secrecy,--that the king would have me</div>
                     <div class="line">present the princess, sweet chuck, with some</div>
                     <div class="line">delightful ostentation, or show, or pageant, or</div>
                     <div class="line">antique, or firework. Now, understanding that the</div>
                     <div class="line">curate and your sweet self are good at such</div>
                     <div class="line">eruptions and sudden breaking out of mirth, as it</div>
                     <div class="line">were, I have acquainted you withal, to the end to</div>
                     <div class="line">crave your assistance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, you shall present before her the Nine Worthies.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, as concerning some entertainment of time, some</div>
                     <div class="line">show in the posterior of this day, to be rendered by</div>
                     <div class="line">our assistants, at the king's command, and this most</div>
                     <div class="line">gallant, illustrate, and learned gentleman, before</div>
                     <div class="line">the princess; I say none so fit as to present the</div>
                     <div class="line">Nine Worthies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SIR NATHANIEL</div>
                     <div class="line">Where will you find men worthy enough to present them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Joshua, yourself; myself and this gallant gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">Judas Maccabaeus; this swain, because of his great</div>
                     <div class="line">limb or joint, shall pass Pompey the Great; the</div>
                     <div class="line">page, Hercules,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon, sir; error: he is not quantity enough for</div>
                     <div class="line">that Worthy's thumb: he is not so big as the end of his club.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I have audience? he shall present Hercules in</div>
                     <div class="line">minority: his enter and exit shall be strangling a</div>
                     <div class="line">snake; and I will have an apology for that purpose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">An excellent device! so, if any of the audience</div>
                     <div class="line">hiss, you may cry 'Well done, Hercules! now thou</div>
                     <div class="line">crushest the snake!' that is the way to make an</div>
                     <div class="line">offence gracious, though few have the grace to do it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">For the rest of the Worthies?--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">I will play three myself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrice-worthy gentleman!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I tell you a thing?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">We attend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">We will have, if this fadge not, an antique. I</div>
                     <div class="line">beseech you, follow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Via, goodman Dull! thou hast spoken no word all this while.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor understood none neither, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Allons! we will employ thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make one in a dance, or so; or I will play</div>
                     <div class="line">On the tabour to the Worthies, and let them dance the hay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">Most dull, honest Dull! To our sport, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter the PRINCESS, KATHARINE, ROSALINE, and MARIA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet hearts, we shall be rich ere we depart,</div>
                     <div class="line">If fairings come thus plentifully in:</div>
                     <div class="line">A lady wall'd about with diamonds!</div>
                     <div class="line">Look you what I have from the loving king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Madame, came nothing else along with that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but this! yes, as much love in rhyme</div>
                     <div class="line">As would be cramm'd up in a sheet of paper,</div>
                     <div class="line">Writ o' both sides the leaf, margent and all,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he was fain to seal on Cupid's name.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">That was the way to make his godhead wax,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he hath been five thousand years a boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and a shrewd unhappy gallows too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll ne'er be friends with him; a' kill'd your sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">He made her melancholy, sad, and heavy;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so she died: had she been light, like you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such a merry, nimble, stirring spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">She might ha' been a grandam ere she died:</div>
                     <div class="line">And so may you; for a light heart lives long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">What's your dark meaning, mouse, of this light word?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">A light condition in a beauty dark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">We need more light to find your meaning out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">You'll mar the light by taking it in snuff;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I'll darkly end the argument.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Look what you do, you do it still i' the dark.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">So do not you, for you are a light wench.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed I weigh not you, and therefore light.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">You weigh me not? O, that's you care not for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Great reason; for 'past cure is still past care.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well bandied both; a set of wit well play'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">But Rosaline, you have a favour too:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who sent it? and what is it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">I would you knew:</div>
                     <div class="line">An if my face were but as fair as yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">My favour were as great; be witness this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I have verses too, I thank Biron:</div>
                     <div class="line">The numbers true; and, were the numbering too,</div>
                     <div class="line">I were the fairest goddess on the ground:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am compared to twenty thousand fairs.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, he hath drawn my picture in his letter!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Any thing like?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Much in the letters; nothing in the praise.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauteous as ink; a good conclusion.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair as a text B in a copy-book.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">'Ware pencils, ho! let me not die your debtor,</div>
                     <div class="line">My red dominical, my golden letter:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that your face were not so full of O's!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">A pox of that jest! and I beshrew all shrows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">But, Katharine, what was sent to you from fair Dumain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, this glove.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Did he not send you twain?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, madam, and moreover</div>
                     <div class="line">Some thousand verses of a faithful lover,</div>
                     <div class="line">A huge translation of hypocrisy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Vilely compiled, profound simplicity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">This and these pearls to me sent Longaville:</div>
                     <div class="line">The letter is too long by half a mile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I think no less. Dost thou not wish in heart</div>
                     <div class="line">The chain were longer and the letter short?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, or I would these hands might never part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">We are wise girls to mock our lovers so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">They are worse fools to purchase mocking so.</div>
                     <div class="line">That same Biron I'll torture ere I go:</div>
                     <div class="line">O that I knew he were but in by the week!</div>
                     <div class="line">How I would make him fawn and beg and seek</div>
                     <div class="line">And wait the season and observe the times</div>
                     <div class="line">And spend his prodigal wits in bootless rhymes</div>
                     <div class="line">And shape his service wholly to my hests</div>
                     <div class="line">And make him proud to make me proud that jests!</div>
                     <div class="line">So perttaunt-like would I o'ersway his state</div>
                     <div class="line">That he should be my fool and I his fate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">None are so surely caught, when they are catch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">As wit turn'd fool: folly, in wisdom hatch'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath wisdom's warrant and the help of school</div>
                     <div class="line">And wit's own grace to grace a learned fool.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">The blood of youth burns not with such excess</div>
                     <div class="line">As gravity's revolt to wantonness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Folly in fools bears not so strong a note</div>
                     <div class="line">As foolery in the wise, when wit doth dote;</div>
                     <div class="line">Since all the power thereof it doth apply</div>
                     <div class="line">To prove, by wit, worth in simplicity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Boyet, and mirth is in his face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BOYET</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">O, I am stabb'd with laughter! Where's her grace?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy news Boyet?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Prepare, madam, prepare!</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm, wenches, arm! encounters mounted are</div>
                     <div class="line">Against your peace: Love doth approach disguised,</div>
                     <div class="line">Armed in arguments; you'll be surprised:</div>
                     <div class="line">Muster your wits; stand in your own defence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or hide your heads like cowards, and fly hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint Denis to Saint Cupid! What are they</div>
                     <div class="line">That charge their breath against us? say, scout, say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the cool shade of a sycamore</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought to close mine eyes some half an hour;</div>
                     <div class="line">When, lo! to interrupt my purposed rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Toward that shade I might behold addrest</div>
                     <div class="line">The king and his companions: warily</div>
                     <div class="line">I stole into a neighbour thicket by,</div>
                     <div class="line">And overheard what you shall overhear,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, by and by, disguised they will be here.</div>
                     <div class="line">Their herald is a pretty knavish page,</div>
                     <div class="line">That well by heart hath conn'd his embassage:</div>
                     <div class="line">Action and accent did they teach him there;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Thus must thou speak,' and 'thus thy body bear:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And ever and anon they made a doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">Presence majestical would put him out,</div>
                     <div class="line">'For,' quoth the king, 'an angel shalt thou see;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet fear not thou, but speak audaciously.'</div>
                     <div class="line">The boy replied, 'An angel is not evil;</div>
                     <div class="line">I should have fear'd her had she been a devil.'</div>
                     <div class="line">With that, all laugh'd and clapp'd him on the shoulder,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making the bold wag by their praises bolder:</div>
                     <div class="line">One rubb'd his elbow thus, and fleer'd and swore</div>
                     <div class="line">A better speech was never spoke before;</div>
                     <div class="line">Another, with his finger and his thumb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cried, 'Via! we will do't, come what will come;'</div>
                     <div class="line">The third he caper'd, and cried, 'All goes well;'</div>
                     <div class="line">The fourth turn'd on the toe, and down he fell.</div>
                     <div class="line">With that, they all did tumble on the ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">With such a zealous laughter, so profound,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in this spleen ridiculous appears,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cheque their folly, passion's solemn tears.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">But what, but what, come they to visit us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">They do, they do: and are apparell'd thus.</div>
                     <div class="line">Like Muscovites or Russians, as I guess.</div>
                     <div class="line">Their purpose is to parle, to court and dance;</div>
                     <div class="line">And every one his love-feat will advance</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto his several mistress, which they'll know</div>
                     <div class="line">By favours several which they did bestow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">And will they so? the gallants shall be task'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, ladies, we shall every one be mask'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">And not a man of them shall have the grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Despite of suit, to see a lady's face.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, Rosaline, this favour thou shalt wear,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then the king will court thee for his dear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, take thou this, my sweet, and give me thine,</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall Biron take me for Rosaline.</div>
                     <div class="line">And change your favours too; so shall your loves</div>
                     <div class="line">Woo contrary, deceived by these removes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, then; wear the favours most in sight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">But in this changing what is your intent?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">The effect of my intent is to cross theirs:</div>
                     <div class="line">They do it but in mocking merriment;</div>
                     <div class="line">And mock for mock is only my intent.</div>
                     <div class="line">Their several counsels they unbosom shall</div>
                     <div class="line">To loves mistook, and so be mock'd withal</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the next occasion that we meet,</div>
                     <div class="line">With visages displayed, to talk and greet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">But shall we dance, if they desire to't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, to the death, we will not move a foot;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor to their penn'd speech render we no grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">But while 'tis spoke each turn away her face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that contempt will kill the speaker's heart,</div>
                     <div class="line">And quite divorce his memory from his part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I do it; and I make no doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">The rest will ne'er come in, if he be out</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no such sport as sport by sport o'erthrown,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make theirs ours and ours none but our own:</div>
                     <div class="line">So shall we stay, mocking intended game,</div>
                     <div class="line">And they, well mock'd, depart away with shame.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpets sound within</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">The trumpet sounds: be mask'd; the maskers come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>The Ladies mask</p>
               <p>Enter Blackamoors with music; MOTH; FERDINAND,
BIRON, LONGAVILLE, and DUMAIN, in Russian habits,
and masked</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">All hail, the richest beauties on the earth!--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Beauties no richer than rich taffeta.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">A holy parcel of the fairest dames.</div>
                     <p>The Ladies turn their backs to him</p>
                     <div class="line">That ever turn'd their--backs--to mortal views!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to MOTH</span>  Their eyes, villain, their eyes!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever turn'd their eyes to mortal views!--Out--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">True; out indeed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of your favours, heavenly spirits, vouchsafe</div>
                     <div class="line">Not to behold--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to MOTH</span>  Once to behold, rogue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Once to behold with your sun-beamed eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">--with your sun-beamed eyes--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">They will not answer to that epithet;</div>
                     <div class="line">You were best call it 'daughter-beamed eyes.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">They do not mark me, and that brings me out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this your perfectness? be gone, you rogue!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit MOTH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">What would these strangers? know their minds, Boyet:</div>
                     <div class="line">If they do speak our language, 'tis our will:</div>
                     <div class="line">That some plain man recount their purposes</div>
                     <div class="line">Know what they would.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">What would you with the princess?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but peace and gentle visitation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">What would they, say they?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing but peace and gentle visitation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that they have; and bid them so be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">She says, you have it, and you may be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Say to her, we have measured many miles</div>
                     <div class="line">To tread a measure with her on this grass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">They say, that they have measured many a mile</div>
                     <div class="line">To tread a measure with you on this grass.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not so. Ask them how many inches</div>
                     <div class="line">Is in one mile: if they have measured many,</div>
                     <div class="line">The measure then of one is easily told.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">If to come hither you have measured miles,</div>
                     <div class="line">And many miles, the princess bids you tell</div>
                     <div class="line">How many inches doth fill up one mile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell her, we measure them by weary steps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">She hears herself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">How many weary steps,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of many weary miles you have o'ergone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are number'd in the travel of one mile?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">We number nothing that we spend for you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our duty is so rich, so infinite,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we may do it still without accompt.</div>
                     <div class="line">Vouchsafe to show the sunshine of your face,</div>
                     <div class="line">That we, like savages, may worship it.</div>
