               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">For the ass to the Jude; give it him:--Jud-as, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HOLOFERNES</div>
                     <div class="line">This is not generous, not gentle, not humble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">A light for Monsieur Judas! it grows dark, he may stumble.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>HOLOFERNES retires</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, poor Maccabaeus, how hath he been baited!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, for Hector</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Hide thy head, Achilles: here comes Hector in arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Though my mocks come home by me, I will now be merry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector was but a Troyan in respect of this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">But is this Hector?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">I think Hector was not so clean-timbered.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">His leg is too big for Hector's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">More calf, certain.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">No; he is best endued in the small.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">This cannot be Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">He's a god or a painter; for he makes faces.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The armipotent Mars, of lances the almighty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave Hector a gift,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">A gilt nutmeg.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">A lemon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stuck with cloves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">No, cloven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace!--</div>
                     <div class="line">The armipotent Mars, of lances the almighty</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave Hector a gift, the heir of Ilion;</div>
                     <div class="line">A man so breathed, that certain he would fight; yea</div>
                     <div class="line">From morn till night, out of his pavilion.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am that flower,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">That mint.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">That columbine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Lord Longaville, rein thy tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I must rather give it the rein, for it runs against Hector.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and Hector's a greyhound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The sweet war-man is dead and rotten; sweet chucks,</div>
                     <div class="line">beat not the bones of the buried: when he breathed,</div>
                     <div class="line">he was a man. But I will forward with my device.</div>
                     <p>To the PRINCESS</p>
                     <div class="line">Sweet royalty, bestow on me the sense of hearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, brave Hector: we are much delighted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I do adore thy sweet grace's slipper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to DUMAIN</span>  Loves her by the foot,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside to BOYET</span>  He may not by the yard.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">This Hector far surmounted Hannibal,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">The party is gone, fellow Hector, she is gone; she</div>
                     <div class="line">is two months on her way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">What meanest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Faith, unless you play the honest Troyan, the poor</div>
                     <div class="line">wench is cast away: she's quick; the child brags in</div>
                     <div class="line">her belly already: tis yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou infamonize me among potentates? thou shalt</div>
                     <div class="line">die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Then shall Hector be whipped for Jaquenetta that is</div>
                     <div class="line">quick by him and hanged for Pompey that is dead by</div>
                     <div class="line">him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Most rare Pompey!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">Renowned Pompey!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Greater than great, great, great, great Pompey!</div>
                     <div class="line">Pompey the Huge!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector trembles.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Pompey is moved. More Ates, more Ates! stir them</div>
                     <div class="line">on! stir them on!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Hector will challenge him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, if a' have no man's blood in's belly than will</div>
                     <div class="line">sup a flea.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">By the north pole, I do challenge thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not fight with a pole, like a northern man:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll slash; I'll do it by the sword. I bepray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">let me borrow my arms again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Room for the incensed Worthies!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll do it in my shirt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Most resolute Pompey!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOTH</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, let me take you a buttonhole lower. Do you</div>
                     <div class="line">not see Pompey is uncasing for the combat? What mean</div>
                     <div class="line">you? You will lose your reputation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gentlemen and soldiers, pardon me; I will not combat</div>
                     <div class="line">in my shirt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">You may not deny it: Pompey hath made the challenge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet bloods, I both may and will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">What reason have you for't?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The naked truth of it is, I have no shirt; I go</div>
                     <div class="line">woolward for penance.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BOYET</div>
                     <div class="line">True, and it was enjoined him in Rome for want of</div>
                     <div class="line">linen: since when, I'll be sworn, he wore none but</div>
                     <div class="line">a dishclout of Jaquenetta's, and that a' wears next</div>
                     <div class="line">his heart for a favour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter MERCADE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCADE</div>
                     <div class="line">God save you, madam!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome, Mercade;</div>
                     <div class="line">But that thou interrupt'st our merriment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCADE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry, madam; for the news I bring</div>
                     <div class="line">Is heavy in my tongue. The king your father--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dead, for my life!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MERCADE</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so; my tale is told.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthies, away! the scene begins to cloud.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">For mine own part, I breathe free breath. I have</div>
                     <div class="line">seen the day of wrong through the little hole of</div>
                     <div class="line">discretion, and I will right myself like a soldier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Worthies</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">How fares your majesty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Boyet, prepare; I will away tonight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, not so; I do beseech you, stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Prepare, I say. I thank you, gracious lords,</div>
                     <div class="line">For all your fair endeavors; and entreat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of a new-sad soul, that you vouchsafe</div>
                     <div class="line">In your rich wisdom to excuse or hide</div>
                     <div class="line">The liberal opposition of our spirits,</div>
                     <div class="line">If over-boldly we have borne ourselves</div>
                     <div class="line">In the converse of breath: your gentleness</div>
                     <div class="line">Was guilty of it. Farewell worthy lord!</div>
                     <div class="line">A heavy heart bears not a nimble tongue:</div>
                     <div class="line">Excuse me so, coming too short of thanks</div>
                     <div class="line">For my great suit so easily obtain'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">The extreme parts of time extremely forms</div>
                     <div class="line">All causes to the purpose of his speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">And often at his very loose decides</div>
                     <div class="line">That which long process could not arbitrate:</div>
                     <div class="line">And though the mourning brow of progeny</div>
                     <div class="line">Forbid the smiling courtesy of love</div>
                     <div class="line">The holy suit which fain it would convince,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, since love's argument was first on foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not the cloud of sorrow justle it</div>
                     <div class="line">From what it purposed; since, to wail friends lost</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not by much so wholesome-profitable</div>
                     <div class="line">As to rejoice at friends but newly found.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">I understand you not: my griefs are double.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Honest plain words best pierce the ear of grief;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by these badges understand the king.</div>
                     <div class="line">For your fair sakes have we neglected time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Play'd foul play with our oaths: your beauty, ladies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath much deform'd us, fashioning our humours</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to the opposed end of our intents:</div>
                     <div class="line">And what in us hath seem'd ridiculous,--</div>
                     <div class="line">As love is full of unbefitting strains,</div>
                     <div class="line">All wanton as a child, skipping and vain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Form'd by the eye and therefore, like the eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of strange shapes, of habits and of forms,</div>
                     <div class="line">Varying in subjects as the eye doth roll</div>
                     <div class="line">To every varied object in his glance:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which parti-coated presence of loose love</div>
                     <div class="line">Put on by us, if, in your heavenly eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have misbecomed our oaths and gravities,</div>
                     <div class="line">Those heavenly eyes, that look into these faults,</div>
                     <div class="line">Suggested us to make. Therefore, ladies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our love being yours, the error that love makes</div>
                     <div class="line">Is likewise yours: we to ourselves prove false,</div>
                     <div class="line">By being once false for ever to be true</div>
                     <div class="line">To those that make us both,--fair ladies, you:</div>
                     <div class="line">And even that falsehood, in itself a sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus purifies itself and turns to grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">We have received your letters full of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your favours, the ambassadors of love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in our maiden council, rated them</div>
                     <div class="line">At courtship, pleasant jest and courtesy,</div>
                     <div class="line">As bombast and as lining to the time:</div>
                     <div class="line">But more devout than this in our respects</div>
                     <div class="line">Have we not been; and therefore met your loves</div>
                     <div class="line">In their own fashion, like a merriment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">Our letters, madam, show'd much more than jest.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">So did our looks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">We did not quote them so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, at the latest minute of the hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Grant us your loves.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">A time, methinks, too short</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a world-without-end bargain in.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, my lord, your grace is perjured much,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of dear guiltiness; and therefore this:</div>
                     <div class="line">If for my love, as there is no such cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">You will do aught, this shall you do for me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your oath I will not trust; but go with speed</div>
                     <div class="line">To some forlorn and naked hermitage,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remote from all the pleasures of the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">There stay until the twelve celestial signs</div>
                     <div class="line">Have brought about the annual reckoning.</div>
                     <div class="line">If this austere insociable life</div>
                     <div class="line">Change not your offer made in heat of blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">If frosts and fasts, hard lodging and thin weeds</div>
                     <div class="line">Nip not the gaudy blossoms of your love,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that it bear this trial and last love;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, at the expiration of the year,</div>
                     <div class="line">Come challenge me, challenge me by these deserts,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by this virgin palm now kissing thine</div>
                     <div class="line">I will be thine; and till that instant shut</div>
                     <div class="line">My woeful self up in a mourning house,</div>
                     <div class="line">Raining the tears of lamentation</div>
                     <div class="line">For the remembrance of my father's death.</div>
                     <div class="line">If this thou do deny, let our hands part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither entitled in the other's heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">If this, or more than this, I would deny,</div>
                     <div class="line">To flatter up these powers of mine with rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">The sudden hand of death close up mine eye!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence ever then my heart is in thy breast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">[And what to me, my love? and what to me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">You must be purged too, your sins are rack'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">You are attaint with faults and perjury:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore if you my favour mean to get,</div>
                     <div class="line">A twelvemonth shall you spend, and never rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">But seek the weary beds of people sick.]</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">But what to me, my love? but what to me? A wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">A beard, fair health, and honesty;</div>
                     <div class="line">With three-fold love I wish you all these three.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, shall I say, I thank you, gentle wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not so, my lord; a twelvemonth and a day</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll mark no words that smooth-faced wooers say:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come when the king doth to my lady come;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, if I have much love, I'll give you some.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll serve thee true and faithfully till then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KATHARINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet swear not, lest ye be forsworn again.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">What says Maria?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">At the twelvemonth's end</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll change my black gown for a faithful friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stay with patience; but the time is long.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MARIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The liker you; few taller are so young.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Studies my lady? mistress, look on me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold the window of my heart, mine eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">What humble suit attends thy answer there:</div>
                     <div class="line">Impose some service on me for thy love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Oft have I heard of you, my Lord Biron,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before I saw you; and the world's large tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Proclaims you for a man replete with mocks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of comparisons and wounding flouts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which you on all estates will execute</div>
                     <div class="line">That lie within the mercy of your wit.</div>
                     <div class="line">To weed this wormwood from your fruitful brain,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therewithal to win me, if you please,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the which I am not to be won,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall this twelvemonth term from day to day</div>
                     <div class="line">Visit the speechless sick and still converse</div>
                     <div class="line">With groaning wretches; and your task shall be,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all the fierce endeavor of your wit</div>
                     <div class="line">To enforce the pained impotent to smile.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">To move wild laughter in the throat of death?</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be; it is impossible:</div>
                     <div class="line">Mirth cannot move a soul in agony.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROSALINE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that's the way to choke a gibing spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose influence is begot of that loose grace</div>
                     <div class="line">Which shallow laughing hearers give to fools:</div>
                     <div class="line">A jest's prosperity lies in the ear</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him that hears it, never in the tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him that makes it: then, if sickly ears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Deaf'd with the clamours of their own dear groans,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will hear your idle scorns, continue then,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will have you and that fault withal;</div>
                     <div class="line">But if they will not, throw away that spirit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I shall find you empty of that fault,</div>
                     <div class="line">Right joyful of your reformation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">A twelvemonth! well; befall what will befall,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll jest a twelvemonth in an hospital.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To FERDINAND</span>  Ay, sweet my lord; and so I take my leave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">No, madam; we will bring you on your way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">Our wooing doth not end like an old play;</div>
                     <div class="line">Jack hath not Jill: these ladies' courtesy</div>
                     <div class="line">Might well have made our sport a comedy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, sir, it wants a twelvemonth and a day,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then 'twill end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                     <div class="line">That's too long for a play.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet majesty, vouchsafe me,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PRINCESS</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not that Hector?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                     <div class="line">The worthy knight of Troy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">I will kiss thy royal finger, and take leave. I am</div>
                     <div class="line">a votary; I have vowed to Jaquenetta to hold the</div>
                     <div class="line">plough for her sweet love three years. But, most</div>
                     <div class="line">esteemed greatness, will you hear the dialogue that</div>
                     <div class="line">the two learned men have compiled in praise of the</div>
                     <div class="line">owl and the cuckoo? It should have followed in the</div>
                     <div class="line">end of our show.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                     <div class="line">Call them forth quickly; we will do so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">Holla! approach.</div>
                     <p>Re-enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, MOTH, COSTARD,
and others</p>
                     <div class="line">This side is Hiems, Winter, this Ver, the Spring;</div>
                     <div class="line">the one maintained by the owl, the other by the</div>
                     <div class="line">cuckoo. Ver, begin.</div>
                     <p>THE SONG</p>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">SPRING.</h3>
                     <div class="line">When daisies pied and violets blue</div>
                     <div class="line">And lady-smocks all silver-white</div>
                     <div class="line">And cuckoo-buds of yellow hue</div>
                     <div class="line">Do paint the meadows with delight,</div>
                     <div class="line">The cuckoo then, on every tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mocks married men; for thus sings he,  Cuckoo;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cuckoo, cuckoo: O word of fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unpleasing to a married ear!</div>
                     <div class="line">When shepherds pipe on oaten straws</div>
                     <div class="line">And merry larks are ploughmen's clocks,</div>
                     <div class="line">When turtles tread, and rooks, and daws,</div>
                     <div class="line">And maidens bleach their summer smocks</div>
                     <div class="line">The cuckoo then, on every tree,</div>
                     <div class="line">Mocks married men; for thus sings he,  Cuckoo;</div>
                     <div class="line">Cuckoo, cuckoo: O word of fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unpleasing to a married ear!</div>
                     <h3 class="bridgehead">WINTER.</h3>
                     <div class="line">When icicles hang by the wall</div>
                     <div class="line">And Dick the shepherd blows his nail</div>
                     <div class="line">And Tom bears logs into the hall</div>
                     <div class="line">And milk comes frozen home in pail,</div>
                     <div class="line">When blood is nipp'd and ways be foul,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then nightly sings the staring owl,  Tu-whit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tu-who, a merry note,</div>
                     <div class="line">While greasy Joan doth keel the pot.</div>
                     <div class="line">When all aloud the wind doth blow</div>
                     <div class="line">And coughing drowns the parson's saw</div>
                     <div class="line">And birds sit brooding in the snow</div>
                     <div class="line">And Marian's nose looks red and raw,</div>
                     <div class="line">When roasted crabs hiss in the bowl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then nightly sings the staring owl,  Tu-whit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tu-who, a merry note,</div>
                     <div class="line">While greasy Joan doth keel the pot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO</div>
                     <div class="line">The words of Mercury are harsh after the songs of</div>
                     <div class="line">Apollo. You that way: we this way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>

      <title>Love's Labour's Lost</title>
   </head>

                     </ul>

                           </span>

                     </ul>
                  </li>

            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">FERDINAND, king of Navarre.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">BIRON</span>
                              <span class="personname">LONGAVILLE</span>
                              <span class="personname">DUMAIN</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">lords attending on the King.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">BOYET</span>
                              <span class="personname">MERCADE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">lords attending on the Princess of France.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, a fantastical Spaniard.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SIR NATHANIEL, a curate.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">HOLOFERNES, a schoolmaster.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">DULL, a constable.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">COSTARD, a clown.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">MOTH, page to Armado.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Forester.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">The PRINCESS of France.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">ROSALINE</span>
                              <span class="personname">MARIA</span>
                              <span class="personname">KATHARINE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">ladies attending on the Princess.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JAQUENETTA, a country wench.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Lords, Attendants, &c.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Navarre.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  The king of Navarre's park.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  The king of Navarre's park.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter FERDINAND king of Navarre, BIRON, LONGAVILLE
and DUMAIN</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Let fame, that all hunt after in their lives,</div>
                              <div class="line">Live register'd upon our brazen tombs</div>
                              <div class="line">And then grace us in the disgrace of death;</div>
                              <div class="line">When, spite of cormorant devouring Time,</div>
                              <div class="line">The endeavor of this present breath may buy</div>
                              <div class="line">That honour which shall bate his scythe's keen edge</div>
                              <div class="line">And make us heirs of all eternity.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, brave conquerors,--for so you are,</div>
                              <div class="line">That war against your own affections</div>
                              <div class="line">And the huge army of the world's desires,--</div>
                              <div class="line">Our late edict shall strongly stand in force:</div>
                              <div class="line">Navarre shall be the wonder of the world;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our court shall be a little Academe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Still and contemplative in living art.</div>
                              <div class="line">You three, Biron, Dumain, and Longaville,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have sworn for three years' term to live with me</div>
                              <div class="line">My fellow-scholars, and to keep those statutes</div>
                              <div class="line">That are recorded in this schedule here:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your oaths are pass'd; and now subscribe your names,</div>
                              <div class="line">That his own hand may strike his honour down</div>
                              <div class="line">That violates the smallest branch herein:</div>
                              <div class="line">If you are arm'd to do as sworn to do,</div>
                              <div class="line">Subscribe to your deep oaths, and keep it too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am resolved; 'tis but a three years' fast:</div>
                              <div class="line">The mind shall banquet, though the body pine:</div>
                              <div class="line">Fat paunches have lean pates, and dainty bits</div>
                              <div class="line">Make rich the ribs, but bankrupt quite the wits.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                              <div class="line">My loving lord, Dumain is mortified:</div>
                              <div class="line">The grosser manner of these world's delights</div>
                              <div class="line">He throws upon the gross world's baser slaves:</div>
                              <div class="line">To love, to wealth, to pomp, I pine and die;</div>
                              <div class="line">With all these living in philosophy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">I can but say their protestation over;</div>
                              <div class="line">So much, dear liege, I have already sworn,</div>
                              <div class="line">That is, to live and study here three years.</div>
                              <div class="line">But there are other strict observances;</div>
                              <div class="line">As, not to see a woman in that term,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I hope well is not enrolled there;</div>
                              <div class="line">And one day in a week to touch no food</div>
                              <div class="line">And but one meal on every day beside,</div>
                              <div class="line">The which I hope is not enrolled there;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then, to sleep but three hours in the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not be seen to wink of all the day--</div>
                              <div class="line">When I was wont to think no harm all night</div>
                              <div class="line">And make a dark night too of half the day--</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I hope well is not enrolled there:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, these are barren tasks, too hard to keep,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to see ladies, study, fast, not sleep!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Your oath is pass'd to pass away from these.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me say no, my liege, an if you please:</div>
                              <div class="line">I only swore to study with your grace</div>
                              <div class="line">And stay here in your court for three years' space.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">You swore to that, Biron, and to the rest.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">By yea and nay, sir, then I swore in jest.</div>
                              <div class="line">What is the end of study? let me know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, that to know, which else we should not know.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Things hid and barr'd, you mean, from common sense?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that is study's godlike recompense.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, then; I will swear to study so,</div>
                              <div class="line">To know the thing I am forbid to know:</div>
                              <div class="line">As thus,--to study where I well may dine,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I to feast expressly am forbid;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or study where to meet some mistress fine,</div>
                              <div class="line">When mistresses from common sense are hid;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, having sworn too hard a keeping oath,</div>
                              <div class="line">Study to break it and not break my troth.</div>
                              <div class="line">If study's gain be thus and this be so,</div>
                              <div class="line">Study knows that which yet it doth not know:</div>
                              <div class="line">Swear me to this, and I will ne'er say no.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">These be the stops that hinder study quite</div>
                              <div class="line">And train our intellects to vain delight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, all delights are vain; but that most vain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which with pain purchased doth inherit pain:</div>
                              <div class="line">As, painfully to pore upon a book</div>
                              <div class="line">To seek the light of truth; while truth the while</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth falsely blind the eyesight of his look:</div>
                              <div class="line">Light seeking light doth light of light beguile:</div>
                              <div class="line">So, ere you find where light in darkness lies,</div>
                              <div class="line">Your light grows dark by losing of your eyes.</div>
                              <div class="line">Study me how to please the eye indeed</div>
                              <div class="line">By fixing it upon a fairer eye,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who dazzling so, that eye shall be his heed</div>
                              <div class="line">And give him light that it was blinded by.</div>
                              <div class="line">Study is like the heaven's glorious sun</div>
                              <div class="line">That will not be deep-search'd with saucy looks:</div>
                              <div class="line">Small have continual plodders ever won</div>
                              <div class="line">Save base authority from others' books</div>
                              <div class="line">These earthly godfathers of heaven's lights</div>
                              <div class="line">That give a name to every fixed star</div>
                              <div class="line">Have no more profit of their shining nights</div>
                              <div class="line">Than those that walk and wot not what they are.</div>
                              <div class="line">Too much to know is to know nought but fame;</div>
                              <div class="line">And every godfather can give a name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">How well he's read, to reason against reading!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                              <div class="line">Proceeded well, to stop all good proceeding!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">He weeds the corn and still lets grow the weeding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">The spring is near when green geese are a-breeding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                              <div class="line">How follows that?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Fit in his place and time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUMAIN</div>
                              <div class="line">In reason nothing.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Something then in rhyme.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Biron is like an envious sneaping frost,</div>
                              <div class="line">That bites the first-born infants of the spring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, say I am; why should proud summer boast</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the birds have any cause to sing?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should I joy in any abortive birth?</div>
                              <div class="line">At Christmas I no more desire a rose</div>
                              <div class="line">Than wish a snow in May's new-fangled mirth;</div>
                              <div class="line">But like of each thing that in season grows.</div>
                              <div class="line">So you, to study now it is too late,</div>
                              <div class="line">Climb o'er the house to unlock the little gate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, sit you out: go home, Biron: adieu.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">No, my good lord; I have sworn to stay with you:</div>
                              <div class="line">And though I have for barbarism spoke more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than for that angel knowledge you can say,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet confident I'll keep what I have swore</div>
                              <div class="line">And bide the penance of each three years' day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me the paper; let me read the same;</div>
                              <div class="line">And to the strict'st decrees I'll write my name.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">How well this yielding rescues thee from shame!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  'Item, That no woman shall come within a</div>
                              <div class="line">mile of my court:' Hath this been proclaimed?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Four days ago.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Let's see the penalty.</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'On pain of losing her tongue.' Who devised this penalty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, that did I.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet lord, and why?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">To fright them hence with that dread penalty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">A dangerous law against gentility!</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">'Item, If any man be seen to talk with a woman</div>
                              <div class="line">within the term of three years, he shall endure such</div>
                              <div class="line">public shame as the rest of the court can possibly devise.'</div>
                              <div class="line">This article, my liege, yourself must break;</div>
                              <div class="line">For well you know here comes in embassy</div>
                              <div class="line">The French king's daughter with yourself to speak--</div>
                              <div class="line">A maid of grace and complete majesty--</div>
                              <div class="line">About surrender up of Aquitaine</div>
                              <div class="line">To her decrepit, sick and bedrid father:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore this article is made in vain,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or vainly comes the admired princess hither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">What say you, lords? Why, this was quite forgot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">So study evermore is overshot:</div>
                              <div class="line">While it doth study to have what it would</div>
                              <div class="line">It doth forget to do the thing it should,</div>
                              <div class="line">And when it hath the thing it hunteth most,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis won as towns with fire, so won, so lost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">We must of force dispense with this decree;</div>
                              <div class="line">She must lie here on mere necessity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Necessity will make us all forsworn</div>
                              <div class="line">Three thousand times within this three years' space;</div>
                              <div class="line">For every man with his affects is born,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not by might master'd but by special grace:</div>
                              <div class="line">If I break faith, this word shall speak for me;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am forsworn on 'mere necessity.'</div>
                              <div class="line">So to the laws at large I write my name:</div>
                              <p>Subscribes</p>
                              <div class="line">And he that breaks them in the least degree</div>
                              <div class="line">Stands in attainder of eternal shame:</div>
                              <div class="line">Suggestions are to other as to me;</div>
                              <div class="line">But I believe, although I seem so loath,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am the last that will last keep his oath.</div>
                              <div class="line">But is there no quick recreation granted?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that there is. Our court, you know, is haunted</div>
                              <div class="line">With a refined traveller of Spain;</div>
                              <div class="line">A man in all the world's new fashion planted,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hath a mint of phrases in his brain;</div>
                              <div class="line">One whom the music of his own vain tongue</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth ravish like enchanting harmony;</div>
                              <div class="line">A man of complements, whom right and wrong</div>
                              <div class="line">Have chose as umpire of their mutiny:</div>
                              <div class="line">This child of fancy, that Armado hight,</div>
                              <div class="line">For interim to our studies shall relate</div>
                              <div class="line">In high-born words the worth of many a knight</div>
                              <div class="line">From tawny Spain lost in the world's debate.</div>
                              <div class="line">How you delight, my lords, I know not, I;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, I protest, I love to hear him lie</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will use him for my minstrelsy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">Armado is a most illustrious wight,</div>
                              <div class="line">A man of fire-new words, fashion's own knight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LONGAVILLE</div>
                              <div class="line">Costard the swain and he shall be our sport;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so to study, three years is but short.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter DULL with a letter, and COSTARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is the duke's own person?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">This, fellow: what wouldst?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                              <div class="line">I myself reprehend his own person, for I am his</div>
                              <div class="line">grace's tharborough: but I would see his own person</div>
                              <div class="line">in flesh and blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
                              <div class="line">This is he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DULL</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Arme--Arme--commends you. There's villany</div>
                              <div class="line">abroad: this letter will tell you more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">COSTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, the contempts thereof are as touching me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">FERDINAND</div>
                              <div class="line">A letter from the magnificent Armado.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIRON</div>
